0.title: Hyd police intercept lorry, seize 20,980 kg PDS rice; 2 arrested
0.article_body: Hyderabad City Police have arrested two people and seized 20,980 kg of Public Distribution System (PDS) rice after they intercepted a lorry beside Amarjyothi Weighing Bridge in Balanagar on Wednesday. The accused allegedly used to buy PDS rice from ration card holders for ₹5/kg, transported it for ₹12/kg and earned illegal profits, the police said. Two other accused are absconding.

1.title: This is the victory of 'Aam Aadmi': Manish Sisodia as trends show AAP leading in Punjab
1.article_body: With latest trends showing that AAP is leading in 89 seats in the 117-seat Punjab Assembly, AAP leader and Deputy CM of Delhi Manish Sisodia said, "Punjab has given chance to Arvind Kejriwal's model of governance." He added, "Today, his model of governance has been established at the national level. This is the victory of the 'Aam Aadmi' (common man)."

2.title: Celebrations begin at AAP's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann's residence
2.article_body: Celebrations began at AAP's CM candidate Bhagwant Mann's residence in Sangrur on Thursday as early trends in the counting of votes in Punjab Assembly elections shows that AAP has crossed the majority mark in the state. Mann is leading from Dhuri seat, according to early poll trends. He is leading over his nearest rival and Congress candidate Dalvir Singh Goldy.

3.title: Admissions for nursery quota seats in Delhi to start from March 22
3.article_body: The admission process of the entry-level seats in Delhi's private schools for the Economically Weaker Section (EWS)/Disadvantaged Groups (DG) and Children with Special Needs (CWSN) categories will start online from March 22, officials said. The last date for filing the application is April 4 and the first round of computerised draw of lots will be conducted on April 11.

4.title: Bhagwant Mann leading with 43,000+ votes in Dhuri, Sukbhir Badal trailing in Jalalabad
4.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) CM candidate Bhagwant Mann is leading in Dhuri with over 43,000 votes, as per early trends. Shiromani Akali Dal leader Sukhbhir Badal is trailing in Jalalabad, while Congress leader Manpreet Singh Badal is trailing in Bathinda Urban. Meanwhile, Congress leader Vijay Inder Singla is trailing in Sangrur.

5.title: Jhulan Goswami becomes joint-highest wicket-taker in Women's WC history
5.article_body: India pacer Jhulan Goswami has become the joint-highest wicket-taker in the Women's ODI World Cup history. She equalled the tally of 39 wickets taken by Australia's Lyn Fullston after dismissing Katey Martin during India's match against New Zealand in the ongoing 2022 World Cup. Jhulan finished with 1/41 as New Zealand posted 260/9 in 50 overs.

6.title: Kyiv Mayor's brother releases NFT collection to raise funds for Ukraine
6.article_body: Former Ukrainian professional boxer and Kyiv Mayor's brother Wladimir Klitschko is releasing an NFT collection to support Ukraine. The collection titled 'Vandalz for Ukraine: WhIsBe x Wladimir Klitschko' will be available at the $100, $1,000, and $10,000 price points and a 1-of-1 NFT will be sold for $1 million. Sale proceeds will be donated to Red Cross Ukraine and UNICEF.

7.title: BSF, Punjab Police recover drone along Indo-Pak border in Tarn Taran
7.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) along with Punjab Police recovered a drone from a farm along the India-Pakistan international border at Tarn Taran's Hawelian village on Wednesday. The BSF troops opened fire at the drone that was spotted near pillar number 124/48 after crossing the border on the intervening night of Tuesday and Wednesday.

8.title: SGPC criticises ban on Sikh staff from wearing 'kirpan' at airports
8.article_body: Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) on Wednesday said that it's taking "strict notice" of Sikh employees at airports being barred from wearing 'kirpan'. "In their own country, this discrimination is a major attack on...religious freedom of Sikhs," SGPC President Harjinder Singh Dhami said. Dhami has written a letter to Union Civil Aviation Minister to withdraw an order on the same.

9.title: Musk sends 2nd Starlink terminals shipment to Ukraine, Vice PM shares pic
9.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov on Thursday shared a picture of Ukraine getting its second Starlink terminals shipment, saying, "Elon Musk keeps his word! Thank you for supporting Ukraine and peace in the entire world!" Replying to Mykhailo, Musk said SpaceX has also sent power adapters for car cigarette lighters, solar/battery packs and generators for places with no electricity.

10.title: I was called a caterpillar because of my thick bushy eyebrows: Mrunal
10.article_body: Responding to a query about criticism faced by her for her looks, actress Mrunal Thakur said, "There were times when I was called a caterpillar because of my thick bushy eyebrows." "People told me, 'You are heavy on thighs'. I simply say, 'Yes, I am an Indian and this body is for Indian wear. Do you have...problems?'," added Mrunal.

11.title: Opposition candidate Yoon Suk-yeol wins presidential election in South Korea
11.article_body: Yoon Suk-yeol, the opposition candidate, has won the presidential election in South Korea, defeating the incumbent Lee Jae-myung of the ruling Democratic Party. Yoon bagged 48.59% of the votes while Lee secured 47.80% of the votes. Conceding the defeat, Lee said, "I did my best, but I did not live up to expectations."

12.title: Immensely proud: Riddhima on dad Rishi Kapoor's last film Sharmaji Namkeen
12.article_body: On Wednesday, makers of 'Sharmaji Namkeen' took to their social media handles to announce the release date of late actor Rishi Kapoor's last film. Taking to Instagram, Rishi Kapoor's daughter Riddhima Kapoor Sahni shared a post for him. She wrote, "Today, as I watch the last film of my father...I feel immensely proud...Paresh ji thank you for completing the movie."

13.title: Wasn't allowed same privileges as male actors, fought for acceptance: Sushmita
13.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen said she wasn't allowed to have the same privileges or opportunities that male actors had. "I've had to fight as a woman for many levels of acceptance...I'm older now, so I do have experience and reputation which has taken me years to build," she said, adding, "With experience, you are slowly changing the world."

14.title: 2 held in Hyderabad for cheating people on pretext of online trading
14.article_body: Rachakonda Police on Wednesday arrested two persons for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of online trading. They were arrested after a victim was duped of ₹8.2 lakh, reported Telangana Today. According to police, the accused floated fraudulent firms and offered huge returns in a short span of time. However, after collecting money they shut down the firms, police added.

15.title: Tanzanian national held with heroin worth ₹32 cr at Ahmedabad airport
15.article_body: A Tanzanian national was arrested with 4.5 kg of heroin worth ₹32 crore at Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International airport in Ahmedabad by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI). Four packets containing a brown powdery substance were found in his luggage which turned out to be heroin on preliminary tests. The accused had arrived from Sharjah on Wednesday, DRI said.

16.title: Who is leading where in Assembly elections 2022 as per latest trends?
16.article_body: As per latest trends, BJP is leading in 259, SP in 128 and BSP in 7 seats in UP Assembly elections. In Punjab, AAP is leading in 89, Congress in 13, SAD in 9 and BJP in 5 seats. In Uttarakhand Assembly, BJP is leading in 42 seats and Congress in 23. BJP is leading in 18 seats in Goa.

17.title: Odisha CM announces ₹3 lakh ex gratia as 2 die in bridge collapse
17.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik has expressed grief after two people died and one was injured when a portion of a bridge collapsed at Cuttak's Chhatra Bazar on Wednesday. Patnaik also announced an ex gratia of ₹3 lakh for the deceased's families. "We will continue rescue operations to ensure that no one is left under the debris," DCP Prateek Singh said.

18.title: Aamir always gets over-excited: Big B on him crying after seeing 'Jhund'
18.article_body: Reacting to actor Aamir Khan bursting into tears after watching his film 'Jhund', Amitabh Bachchan joked that Aamir "always" has the habit of getting "over-excited". "Aamir has always been a very good judge of films," added Amitabh. "I remember when I discussed ['Jhund']...with Aamir, he told me I must do this film," Amitabh had earlier said.

19.title: Anti-incumbency to increase against Gehlot after poll results today: BJP
19.article_body: Rajasthan BJP incharge Arun Singh said that anti-incumbency against the state's Congress government will intensify after the Assembly poll results today, adding that the countdown for the end of Ashok Gehlot-led government has started. Gehlot makes promises daily but nobody knows how will he keep them, Singh added. Congress will not get even five seats in UP, Singh further said.

20.title: Goa CM Pramod Sawant reaches counting centre in Panaji
20.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant reached a counting centre in Panaji on Thursday morning as counting of votes began for the recently held Assembly polls. Sawant was apprised about the security measures in place by the police officials. Sawant stated that the BJP will be forming the next government in the state.

21.title: Soldiers of democracy should return with victory certificate: Akhilesh Yadav
21.article_body: As the counting of votes is underway in UP, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Thursday said, "Soldiers of democracy should return with a victory certificate." "Thank you from the bottom of my heart to every single worker, supporter, leader, office bearer and well-wisher of the SP-alliance for being alert and vigilant at the counting centres day and night," Yadav tweeted.

22.title: When 'Aam Aadmi' rises, thrones shake: Raghav Chadha on poll results day
22.article_body: While counting of votes remains underway, Aam Aadmi Party's Punjab co-incharge Raghav Chadha said, "When 'Aam Aadmi' rises mightiest of thrones shake. Today's an important day in India's history, not only because AAP is winning one more state but because it has become a national force. AAP will become Congress' replacement," he added.

23.title: Ukrainian envoy urges UK to relax visa rules for refugees fleeing war
23.article_body: The Ukrainian envoy in UK urged the government to suspend visa requirements for refugees fleeing Ukraine to escape Russian attack. This comes after the UK government acknowledged that fewer than 1,000 visas have been processed out of 22,000 applications so far. If the government gives temporary relief, we will take care of the refugees, said Ambassador Vadym Prystaiko.

24.title: Indonesia's Merapi volcano unleashes lava, forcing hundreds to evacuate
24.article_body: Merapi volcano in Indonesia erupted overnight, sending hot lava and ash down its slopes and forcing over 250 residents in the surrounding area to evacuate, the country's disaster mitigation agency said on Thursday. The agency also warned people living within 7 km of the volcano to keep away. The 2,963 metre-high Merapi is one of Indonesia's most active volcanoes.

25.title: Goa CM Pramod Sawant trailing in early trends; Utpal Parrikar, Amit Palekar also trailing
25.article_body: Goa CM and BJP candidate from Sanquelim, Pramod Sawant, is trailing by around 300 votes in Assembly elections, according to early trends. Congress candidate Dharmesh Saglani is leading from Sanquelim. Former Union Minister and Goa CM Manohar Parrikar's son, Utpal Parrikar, who had quit BJP to contest from Panaji is also trailing. AAP's CM face Amit Palekar	is also trailing.

26.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami, Harish Rawat trailing as per early trends in U'khand polls
26.article_body: As per early trends in Uttarakhand Assembly elections, BJP candidate and Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami is trailing in the Khatima Assembly constituency. Trends further show that former Uttarakhand Chief Minister and Congress leader Harish Rawat is also trailing in the Lalkuwa Assembly constituency. As per the early trends, the BJP is leading with 47 seats in the state.

27.title: Amish Tripathi's Shiva Trilogy to be adapted into web series
27.article_body: Author Amish Tripathi's Shiva Trilogy is being adapted into a web series. International Art Machine has acquired the rights to his Shiva Trilogy, which includes the books 'The Immortals of Meluha', 'The Secret of the Nagas' and 'The Oath of the Vayuputras'. Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur has been roped in to direct the first instalment 'The Immortals of Meluha'.

28.title: Sitting CMs of Punjab, Goa and Uttarakhand trailing in early trends in Assembly polls
28.article_body: As per early trends in Assembly elections, the sitting Chief Minister of Punjab, Charanjit Singh Channi, is trailing from both Chamkaur Sahib and Bhadaur seats. Goa CM Pramod Sawant is trailing from Sanquelim seat. Meanwhile, Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami is trailing from Khatima, as per early trends.

29.title: Yogi Adityanath, Akhilesh Yadav leading in early trends in UP polls, SP Maurya trailing
29.article_body: As per the early trends in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath is leading by a huge margin in the Gorakhpur Urban seat, while Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav is leading in Karhal constituency. Swami Prasad Maurya, who joined SP from BJP ahead of the 2022 polls, is trailing from Fazilnagar.

30.title: Knew I had to take on being single mom; felt scared, vulnerable: Malaika
30.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora said she did not pause after she decided to become a single mother. "You always feel...the whole world is crashing on your head...I knew it is something I have to take on...I have to be responsible...I did feel scared, vulnerable, frightened. But I also felt that I had to take one day at a time," she added.

31.title: Punjab teacher absent from duty for 5 months, disciplinary action taken
31.article_body: The district education department of Punjab's Mohali has initiated disciplinary action against Karala school teacher, Karamjit Singh, who has not reported for duty since last five months. "We found that he has not been reporting for work since October last year. We will charge sheet him under Rule 8 of Punjab Civil Services Rules and initiate inquiry," an official said.

32.title: Want to focus on spiritual journey: Anupamaa's Anagha takes break from acting
32.article_body: TV actress Anagha Bhosale, known for playing Nandini in show 'Anupamaa', revealed that she's taking a break from acting. She said she "couldn't relate to...double standards in showbiz and the pressure to be something that you are not". Anagha added she has been "a very spiritual person" and wants to focus on her spiritual journey and "follow Lord Krishna's teachings".

33.title: Djokovic withdraws from Indian Wells, Miami, says he can't play in the US
33.article_body: World number two Novak Djokovic has confirmed his withdrawal from ATP Masters tournaments in Indian Wells and Miami due to COVID-19 regulations in the US. Current US rules require foreign adult citizens to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter the country and Djokovic remains unvaccinated. "Regulations won't be changing so I won't be able to play," Djokovic tweeted.

34.title: Issue caste certificate to adopted boy based on mother's caste: Bombay HC
34.article_body: The Bombay HC directed Dharavi's Deputy Collector to issue a caste certificate to the adopted son of a single mother, assigning him the same caste as her. In 2016, the 44-year-old doctor applied for a caste certificate for her adopted son which was rejected by the Deputy Collector, saying her documents could not be accepted for assigning the same caste.

35.title: Bengaluru Police arrests 2 tattoo artists for drug peddling
35.article_body: Bengaluru Police arrested two tattoo artists and their helper for drug peddling. According to police, accused Sigil Varghese and Vishnupriya had come to Bengaluru from Kerala for their studies. They have been involved in drug peddling since 2020 and sold drugs from Kerala and Coimbatore to students at various prestigious colleges in Bengaluru, police added.

36.title: Don't let Ukraine become another Syria, urge UN investigators
36.article_body: The UN Commission of Inquiry on Syria has urged world leaders to work to ensure that Ukraine doesn't become another war-torn country like Syria. "We can only hope that world leaders are doing everything now that they can to avoid a similar fate for Ukraine," said Commission Chair Paulo Pinheiro. The Commission expressed serious concerns over civilian casualties in Ukraine.

37.title: China-Taiwan war would end in miserable victory: Taiwan Defence Min
37.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Minister Chiu Kuo-cheng on Thursday said no matter who wins in any future war between Taiwan and China, it will be a "miserable victory". He added that it was best for everyone to "avoid wars". China claims the democratically governed island as its own and has pledged to bring it under Chinese control, by force if necessary.

38.title: Akshay returns on Kapil's show post rumours of rift, calls him 'unfaithful'
38.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar returned to 'The Kapil Sharma Show' to promote his film, Bachchhan Paandey days after several reports suggested an alleged rift between the duo. Sharing a video on Instagram, Akshay calls Kapil "unfaithful". Alongside the video, he wrote, "We all have an unfaithful person in our lives. In my life, it is Kapil Sharma, who is yours?

39.title: Captain, Sidhu, Channi, Parkash Singh Badal trailing in early trends in Punjab polls
39.article_body: As per early trends in Punjab Assembly elections, former Punjab CM and Punjab Lok Congress leader Captain Amarinder Singh is trailing in Patiala. Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu is trailing in Amritsar East and Charanjit Singh Channi is trailing in both Chamkaur Sahib and Bhadaur. Meanwhile, SAD leader Parkash Singh Badal is trailing in Lambi.

40.title: Early trends show BJP crossing majority mark in UP, U'khand and Goa; AAP in Punjab
40.article_body: Early trends in counting of votes in Assembly elections show BJP crossing majority mark in Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand and Goa. Further, the trends show AAP crossing the majority mark in Punjab. BJP is leading in 240 seats in Uttar Pradesh, 47 seats in Uttarakhand and 21 seats in Goa, as per trends. AAP is leading in 84 seats in Punjab.

41.title: Early trends show BJP crossing majority mark in Uttarakhand Assembly elections
41.article_body: Early trends in counting of votes in Uttarakhand Assembly elections are showing that the BJP is ahead with 35 seats in the state. Trends further show that the Congress party is leading in 22 seats, while AAP is leading in one seat. The counting of votes in the 70-constituency state started at 8 am on Thursday.

42.title: BJP crosses majority mark in Goa Assembly elections, as per early trends
42.article_body: BJP is leading in 21 out of the 40 Assembly seats in Goa, according to the early trends. Congress party is leading in nine Assembly seats, trends showed. West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's TMC party is leading in four seats, while Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's AAP is leading in one seat, as per the trends.

43.title: 2 West Bengal BJP MLAs suspended for disrupting Governor's address
43.article_body: Two West Bengal BJP MLAs were suspended from attending the Assembly for the rest of Budget session on Wednesday after they created disturbances in the House during state Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar's address on March 7. The suspended lawmakers are Natabari MLA Mihir Goswami and Purulia MLA Sudip Mukherjee. This comes as Dhankhar accused female TMC legislators of misbehaving with him.

44.title: Game streaming platform Loco raises $42 mn led by S Korea's Hashed
44.article_body: Game streaming platform Loco has raised $42 million led by South Korea's early-stage venture fund, Hashed. Others who participated in the round include, Makers Fund, Narayana Murthy's Catamaran Ventures, Korea Investment Partners, Krafton, Lumikai and Hiro Capital. Loco had raised $9 million in a funding round in June 2021 led by PUBG parent Krafton.

45.title: Early trends show BJP crossing majority mark in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections
45.article_body: Early trends in the counting of votes in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections show BJP crossing the majority mark of 202 in the state. BJP is leading in 225 seats, while SP is leading in 93 seats. BSP is leading in 7 seats in the state and Congress is leading in 5 seats, the trends showed.

46.title: Sensex opens over 1,200 points higher amid counting of votes in Assembly elections
46.article_body: Sensex surged over 1,200 points to open at over 55,770 on Thursday amid counting of votes in Assembly elections for five states. The broader Nifty was up 314.20 points or 1.92% at 16,659.60. Around 1,860 shares have advanced, 185 shares declined, and 38 shares are unchanged. Asian Paints and Axis Bank jumped up to 5%.

47.title: Kid in 'Jhund' asked 'how does one cry', he was beyond crying: Amitabh
47.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said one of the kids in the film 'Jhund' asked him how does one cry before a scene. “Kid had reached a point where he was beyond crying. He may have never cried in life...Probably his circumstances and the way he lived...were so harsh...maybe he was beyond crying. That moment stayed with me for long,” he added.

48.title: 2,270 FIRs filed in 5 states for COVID norms, MCC violations: CEC
48.article_body: As many as 2,270 FIRs were filed for violation of COVID-19 protocol norms as well as MCC violation in all five states during the ban on poll rallies, Sushil Chandra, Chief Election Commissioner (CEC), said. "During the ban on election rallies due to the Omicron wave, EC took MCC violations seriously…Every political party is the same for EC," Chandra added.

49.title: Fire breaks out in Bengaluru’s Sukh Sagar Hotel; no casualties reported
49.article_body: A fire broke out in Sukh Sagar Hotel located in Bengaluru's Gandhinagar area on Wednesday afternoon. Thick, black smoke was seen rising from the top floor of the hotel which was adjacent to a mall. No casualties were reported in the incident. Two fire engines were rushed to the site and it took about four hours to douse the fire.

50.title: Early trends show AAP crossing halfway mark in Punjab Assembly elections
50.article_body: Early trends in the counting of votes in Punjab Assembly elections show Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) crossing halfway mark in the state. AAP is leading in 68 seats, while Congress is leading in 15 seats. Shiromani Akali Dal is leading in 8 seats in the state and BJP is leading in 5 seats, as per the trends.

51.title: India reports 4,184 new COVID-19 cases, 104 deaths in last 24 hours
51.article_body: India has reported 4,184 new COVID-19 cases and 104 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,575 cases and 145 deaths. Out of the 104 deaths, 33 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 71 were reconciled deaths in Kerala.

52.title: No question of tampering with EVMs: Chief Election Commissioner
52.article_body: After SP chief Akhilesh Yadav alleged that EVMs were being stolen in UP, Chief Election Commissioner Sushil Chandra said there's no question of EVM tampering as Election Commission has always maintained transparency. UP Chief Electoral Officer suspended Varanasi ADM because he hadn't followed the procedures to inform political parties about the movement of EVM for training purposes, Chandra added.

53.title: Proof of genocide: Ukraine Prez on Russia bombing children's hospital
53.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the bombing of the children's hospital by Russia is "the final...proof that a genocide of Ukrainians is taking place". Zelenskyy called on Europeans to "increase sanctions against Russia so that it no longer has any opportunity to continue this genocide".  The attack in Mariupol had injured women in labour and left children in the wreckage.

54.title: Chandigarh's PGIMER to send lab reports to patients via SMS
54.article_body: Chandigarh's PGIMER has launched an SMS facility to update patients about their laboratory reports. As part of its patient-friendly initiative, the patients would now get an SMS on their registered mobile phone numbers once their lab test reports are ready. They can view and download the PDF file of their report using the hyperlink given in the text SMS.

55.title: Delhi HC notice to Centre on Waqf Board's petition regarding 123 properties
55.article_body: The Delhi High Court issued notice to the Centre on Delhi Waqf Board's petition related to 123 properties which mainly include mosques and Muslim graveyards. These properties were to be reverted to the Waqf Board in 2014. The Waqf Board has told the court that Centre is giving these properties to other agencies like ITBP.

56.title: Goa CM offers prayers at Shree Datta Mandir ahead of poll results
56.article_body: Ahead of the Assembly poll results, Goa CM Pramod Sawant offered prayers at the Shree Datta Mandir in his constituency, Sanquelim. This is done in line with traditions set by his predecessor and ex-Union Minister Manohar Parrikar. Addressing media on Wednesday, Sawant expressed confidence that the BJP will be forming the next government in the state.

57.title: Congress will win almost 48 seats in Uttarakhand: Harish Rawat
57.article_body: Congress leader Harish Rawat on Thursday said his party will comfortably win the Uttarakhand Assembly polls by bagging almost 48 seats. "I am confident of Congress' victory in Uttarakhand. Everything will be clear in the next two to three hours," Rawat added. The counting of votes for the recently held polls for the 70-member Uttarakhand Assembly commenced at 8 am.

58.title: Man City reach their 5th straight Champions League quarterfinals
58.article_body: Manchester City reached their fifth straight Champions League quarterfinals despite playing out a goalless draw against Sporting CP in the last-16 second leg on Wednesday night. City advanced 5-0 on aggregate due to their victory in the first-leg. The Pep Guardiola side have reached the last eight along with Bayern Munich, Liverpool and Real Madrid.

59.title: 40-yr-old man sets wife ablaze suspecting extra-marital affair in Chennai, held
59.article_body: The Chennai city police arrested a 40-year-old man for allegedly setting his wife ablaze, suspecting her of having an extra-marital affair. The victim suffered serious burns and was admitted to a hospital. On Monday, the accused came to the house and picked up a fight with his wife. He poured kerosene on her and set her on fire, police said.

60.title: Central Railway commuters to have access to trains' live-location in Mumbai
60.article_body: Commuters of Central Railway in Mumbai will be able to track live locations of trains before boarding. Location would be available on the Yatri application of the railways. Field trials of tracking live locations of locals was conducted on Belapur-Kharkopar route. "We have developed...in-house algorithm to get real-time location of local trains," an official said.

61.title: Hung out with friends with Haryanavi accent: Sumeet on Jugaadistan preparation
61.article_body: Actor Sumeet Vyas said he spent time with friends with "very heavy Haryanavi accent" for preparation of role in television series 'Jugaadistan'. "I was very scared of the accent...They wanted me to speak in way that is understandable by most people...I had few friends who are from that region...I was hanging out with them...don't think they were aware," he said.

62.title: Who is leading where in Assembly elections 2022 as per early trends?
62.article_body: As per latest trends, BJP is leading in Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls with 115 seats. AAP is leading in 24 seats in 117-member Punjab Assembly. In Uttarakhand, BJP is leading in 25 seats, while Congress is leading in 20 seats. In Goa, BJP is leading in 8 seats, while in Manipur, BJP is leading in 4 seats.

63.title: Never considered acting as a career; was more inclined towards business: Navya
63.article_body: Speaking to Barkha Dutt in an interview, actor Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda said she never considered acting as a career. "I was always...inclined towards business. My grandmother and aunt were both working women," she added. "I am also the fourth generation of the Nandas to take over that. I really wanted to carry that legacy forward," Navya said.

64.title: 2 brothers force wives to drink 'black water' to have sons in Pune
64.article_body: Two twin brothers have been booked for alleged domestic violence and using black magic against their twin wives in Pune. According to complaint, the wives alleged that their husbands and in-laws did things like making them drink blackened water so they'd produce a son. One wife was pregnant when superstitious activity was done, DCP (Zone 3) Pornima Gaikwad said.

65.title: 70-yr-old patient's gold bangle stolen at Chandigarh's PGIMER
65.article_body: A 70-year-old patient's gold bangle was stolen while she was waiting for doctor's consultation outside the urology department of PGIMER's New OPD block on Tuesday. The accused used a cutter to remove the bangle from the patient's wrist, police said. "We will check the CCTV footage and try to find the culprit," Kumar Gaurav Dhawan, deputy director (administration), PGIMER said.

66.title: 27-yr-old man arrested for cheating cinema aspirants in Hyderabad
66.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of providing them jobs in the film industry. According to police, a victim filed a complaint after he was duped of ₹90,000. The accused had introduced himself as a manager and assistant director at Ramoji Film City and hosted an app named 'Cine Drive-In', police added.

67.title: 68-yr-old Mumbai woman cheated of ₹11 lakh by Nigerian man on pretext of marriage
67.article_body: A 28-year-old Nigerian national has been arrested for cheating a 68-year-old widow from Mumbai of ₹11 lakh by posing as a UK-based businessman and promising to marry her and take her abroad with him. The accused met the victim on Facebook. As per reports, he allegedly used another person's photograph as his display picture and went by a fake name.

68.title: Alia was a girl, and now, she's a woman: Pooja Bhatt on 'Gangubai...'
68.article_body: Pooja Bhatt has said she watched the first-day first-show of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and heard people whistling in the theatre. "Usually, you don't expect multiplex audiences to whistle...but while watching Gangubai, I heard whistles, screams, yelling," she added. Pooja also praised Alia Bhatt's performance in the film, saying, "She was a girl, and now, she's a woman and she's dazzling."

69.title: Have ensured women feel confident to file complaints: Delhi (Central) DCP
69.article_body: DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan, Central Delhi's first woman DCP in 45 years, in an interview said that there is a need to provide a safe and secure environment to women, for them to realise their full potential. The DCP further said that she has ensured that women feel confident to walk into police stations to lodge complaints.

70.title: Benzema scores hat-trick as Real Madrid knock PSG out of Champions League
70.article_body: Karim Benzema produced a hat-trick as Real Madrid came from being 0-2 down on aggregate to knock PSG out of the Champions League and enter the quarterfinals. Kylian Mbappe's first-half strike put PSG ahead but Benzema's goals in the second half helped Madrid claim 3-1 victory in the second leg on Wednesday night. PSG had won the first-leg 1-0.

71.title: Teacher gets 20-year jail for raping 6-year-old student in Bengaluru
71.article_body: A 46-year-old teacher, Jaishankar, has been sentenced to 20 years of imprisonment and ₹4 lakh fine for raping a six-year-old student in a private school in Bengaluru in 2014. The incident came to light after the minor girl complained of stomachache and was taken to a doctor, after which it was revealed that she was raped in school toilet twice.

72.title: Election Commission is ready for 'One Nation, One Election': CEC Sushil Chandra
72.article_body: 'One Nation One Election' is a good suggestion but it will need a change in the Constitution and it is to be decided in the Parliament, said Chief Election Commissioner Sushil Chandra.  The Election Commission is fully prepared and is capable of conducting simultaneous elections, he added. Chandra said, "According to the Constitution, all the elections should be held simultaneously."

73.title: CCTV image shows Warne walking at Thailand villa moments before his death
73.article_body: A CCTV image has surfaced online showing Australian cricket legend Shane Warne walking at a Thailand villa moments before his death. Warne was walking through the lobby of the villa on the island of Koh Samui after carrying new shirts from his local tailor. Warne passed away due to heart attack aged 52.

74.title: 22-yr-old Ukrainian man charged in ransomware spree extradited to US
74.article_body: A 22-year-old Ukrainian man, Yaroslav Vasinskyi, charged last year with conducting severe ransomware attacks against US targets, has been extradited to the US. Vasinskyi was allegedly behind the July attack against software provider Kaseya. Vasinskyi accessed internal computer networks of several victim companies and deployed Sodinokibi/REvil ransomware to encrypt the data on their computers.

75.title: 1,000 personnel, drones in place as Noida gears up for Assembly poll results
75.article_body: Over 1,000 police personnel, drone cameras and three companies of PAC (Provincial Armed Constabulary) will keep a strict vigil across Gautam Budh Nagar district as the counting of votes for the assembly elections will take place today. The counting of votes for all the three constituencies in GB Nagar will take place at the flower market in Sector 88, Noida.

76.title: Russia may use chemical, biological weapons in Ukraine: US
76.article_body: The US rejected Russian claims that Washington was operating biowarfare labs in Ukraine. "Now that Russia has made these false claims, and China has seemingly endorsed this propaganda, we should all be on...lookout for Russia to possibly use chemical or biological weapons in Ukraine, or to create a false flag operation using them," White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said.

77.title: Duplicate cigarette unit busted in Hyd; items worth ₹2 cr seized
77.article_body: A police task force has busted a duplicate cigarette manufacturing unit in Hyderabad's Sultan Bazaar and seized items worth a total of ₹2 crore from the place. The seizure reportedly includes 500 tobacco bags, each weighing about 25 kg, 170 cigarette filter cartons, 400 cigarette paper rolls of various brands and six silver paper rolls. One person has been arrested.

78.title: Ukraine releases intercepted calls of Russian soldiers talking to their close ones
78.article_body: On its official Twitter account, Ukraine released intercepted calls of Russian soldiers talking to their close ones. "These are real intercepted calls...Looting and war crimes included. Please, share! The world must know the truth of what they're doing to our homes and people," Ukraine tweeted. A Russian soldier can be heard saying, "I drank a f***ing cognac worth 7k."

79.title: 25-yr-old man on way to meet girlfriend dies as truck hits him in Mumbai
79.article_body: A 25-year-old man was killed after a dumper truck hit his motorcycle and ran over him near Mumbai's Kandivali East on Tuesday. The man reportedly lost control after the truck hit his motorcycle from behind. He fell and was crushed under the truck. Police said that the man was on his way to meet his girlfriend in Dahisar.

80.title: It's still not too late to get into crypto: Mudrex
80.article_body: Crypto startup Mudrex stated that while crypto 'maxis' have been bullish on holding a single coin, Mudrex has emerged with the concept of investing in ideas instead of single coins. Mudrex Coin Sets is the flagship product, letting users invest in expert-created crypto baskets, the company said, adding that it is trusted by over 1,00,000 investors across 100+ countries already.

81.title: Counting of votes for Assembly elections in UP, Punjab, U'khand, Goa & Manipur begins
81.article_body: Counting of votes for Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Uttarakhand, Goa and Manipur state Assemblies has begun. Voting took place in Uttar Pradesh in seven phases and in Manipur in two phases, while Punjab, Uttarakhand and Goa saw one phase of voting each. Counting of post ballot votes has started, the counting of votes polled in EVMs will begin at 8.30 am.

82.title: B'luru doctors successfully transplant woman's kidney on 10-yr-old son
82.article_body: Doctors at Bengaluru's Aster CMI Hospital successfully transplanted a mother's kidney on her 10-year-old son in a six-hour-long surgery. The 41-year-old woman had donated one of her kidneys to her son as he was diagnosed with end-stage renal disease. The boy reportedly started showing uremic symptoms like fatigue, muscle cramps and vomiting with high blood pressure when he was nine-year-old.

83.title: India to bowl first against New Zealand in 2022 Women's World Cup, playing XI announced
83.article_body: India captain Mithali Raj won the toss and elected to bowl first against New Zealand in their second 2022 Women's World Cup match at Seddon Park in Hamilton. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Yastika Bhatia replacing Shafali Verma. India have faced New Zealand 53 times in women's ODI cricket, winning 20 times.

84.title: Louis Vuitton hosts its Paris fashion show at Musée d'Orsay museum
84.article_body: High-end luxury fashion label Louis Vuitton took over Musée d'Orsay museum in France to host its Paris fashion show on Monday. The brand's collection showcased models in outsized jackets and shirts layered over colourful dresses as they walked among marble and bronze sculptures. 'Squid Game' actress Hoyeon Jung wore a brown jacket, wide-leg striped pants and a yellow floral tie.

85.title: Told parents to stop reading garbage: Malaika on online trolling
85.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora while talking about online trolling in a recent interview revealed that her parents get affected by it. "My parents would keep saying, 'beta someone said this or that'. And finally, I sat them down and said, 'Enough! Stop reading...this garbage'," she said. The 48-year-old added that after their talk, the trolling topic never came up again.

86.title: 'Kahaani' helped redefine concept of Indian film heroine: Vidya Balan
86.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has said that her 2012 movie, 'Kahaani', played a "huge role" in redefining "the concept of Indian film heroine". The 43-year-old further called the movie one of her "most special films" as it completed 10 years of its release on Wednesday. "I still remember every day on...shoot. It was like our lives depended on it," she added.

87.title: I lost the dream I had been working on for 18 years: Russia's Mazepin on F1 exit
87.article_body: Former Haas driver Nikita Mazepin on Wednesday said he lost the dream he worked towards for 18 years when he found out he was released by American F1 team Haas following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Haas cut ties with Russian driver Mazepin and title sponsor Uralkali, owned by Mazepin's father Dmitry, who is an associate of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

88.title: Reliance stepping in to supply diesel to Europe amid Russia-Ukraine crisis: Report
88.article_body: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Ltd's (RIL) Jamnagar facility is gearing up to supply diesel to Europe amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, a report said. According to Bloomberg, RIL has deferred maintenance work at Jamnagar plant, and is increasing crude processing in a bid to gain from surge in global demand. It's already sending shipments of fuel to Europe, it said.

89.title: Over 2,500 Ukrainian refugees have arrived in Ireland: Minister
89.article_body: Over 2,500 people fleeing the Russian invasion of Ukraine have arrived in Ireland, with children comprising a third of that number, Irish Justice Minister Helen McEntee said on Wednesday. The Irish government has said Ukrainian refugees will receive medical cards, as well as a Personal Public Service (PPS) number, which will enable them to access certain social welfare benefits.

90.title: Governing bodies of tennis, 4 Grand Slams donate $700,000 to Ukraine
90.article_body: The ATP, WTA and the International Tennis Federation (ITF) along with all four Grand Slams - the Australian Open, Wimbledon, the US Open and the French Open on Wednesday announced a joint donation of $700,000 to Ukraine. All seven bodies have donated $100,000 each to support GlobalGiving's Ukraine Crisis Relief Fund, which will aid humanitarian relief efforts.

91.title: 25-yr-old man kidnapped for ₹15 lakh ransom found dead in MP forest
91.article_body: A 25-year-old man suffering from paralysis was found dead in a forest in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur after being allegedly abducted for ₹15 lakh ransom. Identified as Rahul Singh, the victim was reportedly found dead in a ditch in Dharampur forest area on Tuesday and his body was decomposed. Police were alerted after the corpse was found by a cattle grazer.

92.title: 3 pubs in Indore sealed for serving liquor to minors
92.article_body: The local administration sealed three pubs in Indore on Wednesday for serving liquor to minors and committing other irregularities, an official said. "These pubs were found serving liquor to children and also operating beyond the administration-fixed deadline of 11.30 pm," Indore Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) Akshay Singh Markam said. The pubs stocked liquor beyond permissible limits, he said.

93.title: Russian designer removed from Paris Fashion Week amid Ukraine crisis
93.article_body: France's fashion body, Fédération de la Haute Couture et de la Mode, announced that it has removed Russian designer Valentin Yudashkin from this year's Paris Fashion Week calendar amid the Ukraine crisis. President of the fashion body, Ralph Toledano, said, "If he had doubt about the war in Ukraine, it'd have been hard to remove him...That was not the case."

94.title: I'm working today not because of money but for passion: Akshay Kumar
94.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar in a recent media interaction said that he is working in films today "not because of money" anymore, but "for passion". During the promotion of his next release 'Bachchhan Paandey' on Wednesday, the 54-year-old said, "I choose to go to work in...morning and take...break on Sundays." He added, "The day I feel disinterested...I will stop working."

95.title: There will be infighting in Yadav family after UP polls: Minister
95.article_body: Union Minister Kaushal Kishore on Wednesday said that Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav is "perplexed and frustrated", adding that infighting within the family will begin after the declaration of State Assembly election results on Thursday. Referring to Yadav's statements on the electronic voting machines (EVMs), Kishore said that the SP chief doesn't have faith in the Election Commission.

96.title: Amit Shah has landed in Goa to buy other party members: Congress
96.article_body: Congress leader Ivan D'Souza on Wednesday levelled horse-trading allegations on BJP ahead of counting of votes for Goa polls. "Amit Shah is already...in Goa and other leaders also landed in Goa...Just to buy the other party members," he added. He said in 2017, Congress was the single-largest party with 17 members and BJP indulged in horse-trading.

97.title: Nadal has to be the favourite going into Indian Wells: Tommy Haas
97.article_body: Indian Wells tournament director Tommy Haas said 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal is the favourite to win the BNP Paribas Open. "He is, in my opinion, the guy to beat here, there is no doubt about it," Haas said. The current world number four is on a 15-match unbeaten run in 2022 that includes the Australian Open in January.

98.title: Children dying of cancer made to stand in 'Z' shape in snow to support Russia
98.article_body: Terminally ill children at a hospice in Russia were told to stand in the shape of a 'Z' to show support for the invasion of Ukraine. Images posted by Vladimir Vavilov, the chairman of a cancer charity that runs the hospice, show around 60 people gathered in the snow. The letter 'Z' was seen on Russian military equipment in Ukraine.

99.title: Really happy that 'mankad' dismissal has been changed to 'run out': Sachin
99.article_body: Talking about the new cricket rules being introduced by MCC, Sachin Tendulkar said that he is supportive of the 'mankaded' dismissal being changed to 'run-out' category. "I was always uncomfortable with that particular dismissal being called mankaded. I am really happy that it has been changed to run out. It always should have been run out," Sachin added.

100.title: New COVID-19 cases, deaths continue to drop globally: WHO
100.article_body: The World Health Organization on Tuesday said in its weekly report that new COVID-19 cases and deaths continue to drop globally. Compared to the previous week, new cases declined by 5% and deaths declined by 8%. Over 10 million new cases and over 52,000 deaths were reported last week. Only the Western Pacific region reported a 46% increase in cases.

101.title: We know it's going to be a difficult game: Pochettino on Real Madrid
101.article_body: Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) on Wednesday will face Real Madrid in their UEFA Champions League Round of 16 second-leg tie, which PSG manager Mauricio Pochettino says will be "a difficult game". PSG won the first-leg against Real Madrid 1-0. "The best way to approach the game is to play and attack in the opposition's half," Pochettino said.

102.title: 4 die, 2 seriously ill after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar
102.article_body: At least four people have died and two taken seriously ill after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar's West Champaran and Siwan districts, officials said on Wednesday. According to officials, while one death was reported from Khaptola village under the Nautan police station of West Champaran, three others died in Dhebar village under the Daraundha police station limits of Siwan.

103.title: 16-yr-old girl attempts suicide after father rapes her in UP
103.article_body: A 16-year-old girl attempted suicide after she was allegedly raped by her father in a village under the Khudaganj police station area in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Wednesday. The incident took place on March 5, when the girl's mother had gone out to meet relatives, said Superintendent of Police (Rural) Sanjeev Bajpai. The accused has been arrested.

104.title: UN World Food Programme aims to help over 3 mn Ukrainians: Director
104.article_body: United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) aims to help over 3 million Ukrainians with food donations, Director General David Beasley said on Wednesday. Beasley made the remark in Poland's Warsaw at a news conference on efforts to support refugees from Ukraine. Over 2 million people have fled Ukraine since the Russian invasion with Poland hosting about 1.2 million of them.

105.title: Russian soldiers let down by appalling leaders: UK Defence Secy
105.article_body: UK's Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Tuesday said Russian soldiers have suffered the heaviest losses since Russia invaded its neighbour Ukraine and have been "let down by appalling leaders". Ukraine has claimed that over 11,000 Russian soldiers, including four commanders, have already been killed. "We can see that the Russians are having real logistical problems," Wallace said.

106.title: Gathering of people outside counting centres banned in Punjab tomorrow
106.article_body: In view of the counting of votes on Thursday, no gathering of people will be allowed outside counting centres in Punjab. Punjab Chief Electoral Officer S Karuna Raju said victory processions are prohibited as well. Only two people can accompany the winning candidate or his official representative to the counting centre to collect the certificate.

107.title: Part of bridge collapses in Odisha; 2 killed & many feared trapped
107.article_body: Two persons were killed and one was injured after a portion of a bridge collapsed at Chhatra Bazar in Odisha's Cuttack on Wednesday evening. Many people are feared trapped on the spot. An investigation will be done and action will be taken against those found responsible for the incident, District Magistrate Bhabani Shankar Chayani said.

108.title: Prabhas thanks Big B, others for lending voice to 'Radhe Shyam'
108.article_body: Actor Prabhas took to social media to share a note for all those who lent their voices for his upcoming movie 'Radhe Shyam'. He posted the note on Instagram, wherein he thanked filmmaker SS Rajamouli and actors Amitabh Bachchan, Prithviraj Sukumaran and Shiva Rajkumar. It further read, "Expressing my gratitude for making this film even more special for us."

109.title: Tiger found dead in MP's tiger reserve, territorial fight suspected
109.article_body: An adult tiger was found dead in the Pench Tiger Reserve (PTR) in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district. The carcass of the feline, around 12 years old, was said to have been found with multiple injury marks and it was suspected that the animal died in a territorial fight. It was disposed of as per the National Tiger Conservation Authority guidelines.

110.title: PM thanks Hungary's PM for facilitating 6,000 Indians' evacuation
110.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday spoke with his Hungarian counterpart His Excellency Viktor Orban and thanked him for facilitating the evacuation of over 6,000 Indians through the Ukraine-Hungary border. "PM Orban...said that Indian medical students could choose to continue their studies in Hungary if they wished," PMO said. The duo also discussed the situation in Ukraine.

111.title: Kids buried under wreckage as Russian strike hits hospital, Ukraine Prez shares video
111.article_body: Ukrainian officials said a Russian strike has hit a children's hospital and maternity facility in the besieged southeastern port city of Mariupol. A statement on the city council's social media account on Wednesday said the hospital suffered "colossal" damage. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy tweeted that there were "people, children under the wreckage" while sharing a video.

112.title: 18 injured, 4 died during Manipur polls amid high turnout: Report
112.article_body: A total of 18 people have been injured and four have died during the Manipur elections amid a high turnout of voters, according to reports. The EVMs and polling teams were airlifted after three helicopters, including one ALH of Global Vectra and one MI17 of IAF were deployed. The injured people and security forces were reportedly given cashless treatment.

113.title: McDonald's says closing stores in Russia will cost it $50 mn per month
113.article_body: McDonald's on Wednesday said closing stores in Russia in response to the Russia-Ukraine war will cost the fast food chain $50 million a month. McDonald's owns 84% of its Russian locations itself and said it'll continue to pay its 62,000 staff and restaurant employees in Russia. "This is a really challenging and complex situation for...us," said McDonald's CFO Kevin Ozan.

114.title: 6 killed, 3 injured in head-on collision between truck & car in UP
114.article_body: Six men were killed and three were left with critical injuries in a head-on collision between a mini-truck and a car on the Etawah-Mainpuri road in Uttar Pradesh, police said. The crash took place on Wednesday when a group of people from Jaswantnagar area were on their way to attend a function. The injured were admitted to the hospital.

115.title: Germany certainly not sending warplanes to Ukraine: Chancellor Scholz
115.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has said that the country certainly won't send warplanes to Ukraine amid Russian invasion. Scholz's comments came after US rejected Poland's offer to transfer its Russian-made MiG-29 jets to a US base in Germany. "We've provided all kinds of defence materials [to Ukraine] and...sent weapons...but...we have to consider very carefully what we do [next]," Scholz said.

116.title: 3 FIRs filed after confrontation in Mangaluru college over hijab
116.article_body: Three FIRs have been registered in Mangaluru following a confrontation between two student groups over wearing hijab during examination at a college. This comes as Karnataka High Court is yet to announce its verdict over ban on hijab in educational institutions. Police said "one case is registered on a female student's complaint against some other students and 15 ABVP members."

117.title: 22-yr-old cricketer Rahul Chahar marries longtime girlfriend Ishani in Goa, shares pics
117.article_body: Cricketer Rahul Chahar tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend Ishani in Goa on Wednesday. He took to Instagram to share pictures, writing, "Our Happily ever after." Rahul and Ishani had got engaged in December 2019. The 22-year-old leg-spinner, who was part of India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad, was bought by Punjab Kings in IPL mega auction last month.

118.title: ED attaches assets worth ₹1,984 crore in Karvy Stock Broking scam
118.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday said it has attached immovable and movable properties worth ₹1,984 crore belonging to Karvy Stock Broking, its Chairman Comandur Parthasarathy and others in a money laundering case. Attached properties include landed properties worth ₹213.6 crore, tangible/intangible assets worth ₹1,280 crore and Parthasarathy's shareholding worth ₹438.7 crore, ED said.

119.title: 4 robbers distract Guj trader in car, escape with bag containing ₹15 lakh
119.article_body: Four robbers stole a bag containing ₹15 lakhs from the car of a trader in Gujarat's Morbi town on Tuesday. However, two of the accused were caught in Rajkot, while the two others managed to escape. The accused, with the help of a boy, were able to distract the trader and escaped with the bag full of cash.

120.title: Congo militiamen kill 18 civilians in church compound: Report
120.article_body: Militiamen have killed 18 civilians in a church compound in Democratic Republic of Congo on Tuesday, a witness and a local human rights groups said. The civilians were sleeping in the church outbuildings when the attack took place in Banyali Kilo district in the Ituri province, according to a report. They had reportedly fled there after escaping from previous attacks.

121.title: Women hold topless protest against Russia in front of Eiffel Tower; video surfaces
121.article_body: Women part of a feminist group held a topless protest in front of the Eiffel Tower in Paris to protest against Russian invasion of Ukraine. The video of the protest shows their chests painted with colours of the Ukrainian flag and slogans like 'Stop Putin's War', 'Feminists against War' and 'Slava Ukraini' written on them.

122.title: Highly dangerous: Karti on Indian student fighting for Ukraine
122.article_body: On reports that a 21-year-old student from Tamil Nadu will fight for Ukraine against Russia, Congress MP Karti Chidambaram said that this is highly dangerous. "Imagine if a Muslim youth from Coimbatore goes to Syria and fights against Assad. Wouldn't he be called a Jihadi?" he asked. "I don't agree with citizens of other nations joining the war," he added.

123.title: Sarpanch shot dead near Srinagar in J&K, 2nd incident in 1 week
123.article_body: A village sarpanch was shot dead by suspected terrorists on the outskirts of Srinagar in Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday. The victim has been identified as Sameer Ahmad Bhat, the sarpanch of the Khanmoh area. This is the second such incident in a week as a panchayat member in Kulgam district was shot dead by terrorists last Wednesday.

124.title: Kidnapped Bihar businessman rescued, 7 members of gang arrested
124.article_body: The Rohtas Police on Tuesday rescued a businessman from a locked house at Kudra in Bihar's Kaimur district, who was kidnapped on March 5 by an interstate gang, officials said. The kidnappers had demanded a ₹1.5 crore ransom, but the police rescued him and arrested seven members of the gang and recovered an SUV, pistol used in the crime.

125.title: Have ensured peaceful voting, will ensure peaceful counting: UP ADG
125.article_body: Ahead of the counting of votes for the ongoing Assembly elections, Uttar Pradesh Additional Director General of Police (law and order) Prashant Kumar said, "We have ensured peaceful voting, we will ensure peaceful counting also". He also said that 70,000 civil police workers, 245 companies of paramilitary forces and 69 company PSE commanders have been deployed for March 10.

126.title: Man who got world's 1st pig heart transplant dies after 2 months in US
126.article_body: The first person to receive a heart transplant from a pig has died two months after the surgery, the US hospital that performed the surgery announced on Wednesday. While doctors didn't give an exact cause of death, they said 57-year-old David Bennett's condition had begun deteriorating several days earlier. He got a transplant from a genetically modified pig.

127.title: Cong doesn't trust them: Goa CM after party moves candidates to resort
127.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant has said that Congress doesn't trust its candidates after the party reportedly moved its candidates to a resort ahead of Assembly election results. "[Congress is] keeping [candidates] in isolation...without knowing who's winning," he added. Reacting to the possibility of hung Assembly, Sawant said independent candidates will back BJP if it falls short of a majority.

128.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of holding 4,00,000 'hostage' in Mariupol
128.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on Wednesday accused Russia of holding 4,00,000 people 'hostage' in Mariupol and blocking humanitarian aid and evacuation. He took to Twitter and said that almost 3,000 newborn babies lack medicine and food in the city. "I urge the world to act! Force Russia to stop its barbaric war on civilians and babies!" the minister added.

129.title: Redmi launches Note 11 Pro series & Redmi Watch 2 Lite in India today
129.article_body: All-new Redmi Note 11 Pro+ 5G and Redmi Note 11 Pro were launched today. The latest Redmi Note devices that sport 67W Turbo charging promise a full day's charge in just 15 minutes. Redmi also launched Redmi Watch 2 Lite alongside the two smartphones in what was Xiaomi's first on-ground tech launch event of 2022.

130.title: Woman with 2 uteruses gives birth to 2 babies in a year in US, pic surfaces
130.article_body: A woman from Georgia, US gave birth to two babies in one year, as they each grew in her two different uteruses. Caroline Wortman, 30, discovered she was nearly ten weeks pregnant with her second child, just six months after her daughter's birth. She suffers from a rare condition called uterine didelphys, meaning she was born with two reproductive systems.

131.title: World no. 2 Djokovic added to Indian Wells draw despite vaccine status
131.article_body: World number two Novak Djokovic has been added to the Indian Wells draw despite doubts whether he can play in the US event due to his COVID-19 vaccination status. Current US rules require foreign adult citizens to be fully vaccinated to enter the country. Djokovic, who was deported from Australia due to his vaccine status, recently revealed he remains unvaccinated.

132.title: FIFA suspend Ukraine’s WC playoff against Scotland amid war with Russia
132.article_body: FIFA on Tuesday said it suspended Ukraine's World Cup qualifying playoff match against Scotland following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The match was scheduled to be played on March 24. FIFA added Poland has received a bye through their playoff match against Russia that was scheduled to be played the same day. Ukraine's match with Scotland will be organised in June.

133.title: We're going to get clear majority in Goa polls: Cong's Chidambaram
133.article_body: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram expressed confidence in the party's victory in the Goa Assembly elections and stated that Congress is going to get a "clear majority". Chidambaram's comment comes after Goa Congress chief Girish Chodankar claimed that talks are underway with Aam Aadmi Party to obtain support for government formation. Exit polls have predicted a hung Assembly in Goa.

134.title: Ukraine warns of risk of radiation leak after power cut at Chernobyl nuclear plant
134.article_body: Ukrainian nuclear company Energoatom has warned of radiation leak from the occupied Chernobyl nuclear power plant because it cannot cool spent nuclear fuel due to power cut. "The radioactive cloud could be carried by wind to other regions of Ukraine, Belarus, Russia, and Europe," it added. Ukraine has appealed to Russia for a temporary ceasefire to repair the power line.

135.title: Puducherry minister dresses as Goddess, says, 'Knew there'll be -ve feedback'
135.article_body: A video of Puducherry minister S Chandira Priyanga dressed as Goddess was released on Women's Day. After the clip got criticism from few, she said she knew there'll be negative feedback but doesn't care about it. "It's not like putting just another get-up...I underwent fasting and stopped eating non-vegetarian food as I feel this is a sacred thing," she said.

136.title: Upper age limit for appearing in NEET-UG examination removed
136.article_body: Upper age limit for appearing in the undergraduate medical entrance exam, NEET-UG, has been removed for all candidates, the National Medical Commission has said. Earlier, the age limit was 25 years for General category candidates and 30 years for Reserved category candidates. The decision was taken in the fourth NMC meeting held in October last year, the commission's secretary said.

137.title: Sreesanth retires from all forms of Indian domestic cricket
137.article_body: Cricketer Sreesanth announced his retirement from all forms of Indian domestic cricket aged 39. In a video posted on Twitter, Sreesanth said he's looking forward to be a part of a coaching setup and also expressed his interest in playing leagues across the globe once BCCI allows. Sreesanth's seven-year ban over IPL 2013 spot-fixing scandal had ended in September 2020.

138.title: 20,000 foreigners joined Ukraine forces to fight against Russia: Report
138.article_body: Around 20,000 foreigners have joined Ukrainian forces to fight against Russia amid the ongoing war, The Kyiv Independent reported. "Foreign volunteers will be able to obtain Ukrainian citizenship if they want to," it quoted Ukraine's First Deputy Interior Minister Yevhen Yenin as saying. There have been reports of citizens of various nations, including India, volunteering to fight for Ukraine.

139.title: BJP wins 759, Congress 76 of 977 wards in Assam Municipal Board election
139.article_body: The BJP won 759 of the total 977 municipal wards in the Assam Municipal Board election on Wednesday, while the Congress managed to secure a win in 76 wards, the state Election Commission said. Polling for one ward will be done later as a candidate died in the Patacharkuchi municipal board. As many as 59 wards were uncontested.

140.title: Ashneer Grover, wife Madhuri pay ₹8.2 crore advance tax: Report
140.article_body: Former BharatPe Managing Director Ashneer Grover has paid ₹7.1 crore advance tax for the assessment year 2022-23, as per a PTI report. Grover's wife Madhuri Jain has paid ₹1.1 crore advance tax, the report said. "This makes him one of the highest taxpayers among startup founders for two years in a row," PTI added while quoting a source.

141.title: Varanasi officer removed after controversy over EVMs' transportation
141.article_body: Varanasi DM Kaushal Raj Sharma has removed ADM NK Singh over charges of dereliction of duty while transporting EVMs to be used for training ahead of counting of votes in UP. The order said the EVMs were supposed to be transported on Wednesday after informing political parties. Since they weren't informed, confusion followed and hence, Singh has been removed.

142.title: Ukraine bans exports of food staples to prevent 'humanitarian crisis'
142.article_body: Ukraine's government has banned the export of wheat and other food staples to prevent a "humanitarian crisis" in the country amid the Russian invasion, a report stated. It has also prohibited the export of buckwheat, meat and other "byproducts" from cattle. Ukraine's minister Roman Leshchenko said the export ban is needed to "meet the population's need in critical food products".

143.title: Sweden prepares tents, warehouses as refugees from Ukraine arrive
143.article_body: Sweden is preparing tents, sports halls and warehouses to accommodate refugees from Ukraine, Swedish Immigration Minister Anders Ygeman said on Wednesday. Swedish Migration Board is reportedly making arrangements to house approximately 30,000 Ukrainian refugees over the coming months, although the number of arrivals could be higher. Around 2,000 refugees arrived in Sweden on Tuesday, Ygeman added.

144.title: Russia warns as Poland offers to send MIG-29 jets to Ukraine, calls it 'dangerous'
144.article_body: Russia has issued a warning after Poland offered to deliver all of its MIG-29 fighter jets to Ukraine after flying them to a US airbase. "This is a highly undesirable and a potentially dangerous scenario," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. The MIG-29 is a fighter jet that was developed in the Soviet Union.

145.title: MCD polls likely to be delayed; Delhi CM asks, 'Can Centre direct EC?'
145.article_body: Delhi State Election Commissioner SK Srivastava on Wednesday didn't announce dates for MCD polls as EC received a communication from Centre regarding unification of municipal bodies. He said the polls aren't being delayed but EC is seeking legal opinion. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal questioned whether Centre can direct EC to delay polls. "Why is EC buckling under pressure?" he asked.

146.title: Man accused in POCSO case arrested by Delhi Police after 3 years
146.article_body: A 32-year-old man, accused in a Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act case, has been arrested by police after absconding for the past three years. The accused, identified as Sandeep Kumar, of Nangloi, was arrested after his location was tracked down by a police team constituted to keep surveillance on proclaimed offenders. He was first arrested in 2013.

147.title: Hyderabad Mayor shares video of her having lunch with women workers
147.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal shared on Twitter a video of her having lunch with women workers of the civic body on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. "Heartfelt moment to have lunch with the brave women of GHMC...Their contribution in keeping the city clean is commendable," the Mayor wrote on Twitter.

148.title: Pregnant women among 4,000 Better.com workers laid off on Women's Day, says employee
148.article_body: Better.com employee Eric Blattberg shared a colleague's post regarding layoff of roughly 4,000 employees on Tuesday. "Included in...laid-off crowd are pregnant women who trusted Better with their stability," it read. "I wanted to share [the] post calling on Better's leadership...to provide extended medical benefits to currently-pregnant employees they're laying off on...Women's Day," wrote Eric.

149.title: Will stay common man even if I become Punjab CM: AAP's Bhagwant Mann
149.article_body: Ahead of the Punjab Assembly election results, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann said on Wednesday that he will remain a common man even if he gets elected as the CM. "I don't think...politics will mess my head if I [win]," Mann added. Exit polls have indicated a victory for Aam Aadmi Party in Punjab.

150.title: Over 400 people detained by Russian National Guard in Kherson: Ukraine
150.article_body: Ukraine's military high command said on Wednesday that members of Russia's National Guard have detained more than 400 people in Ukraine's Kherson oblast. It said that the people had protested against the occupation of their hometowns by Russian forces. "Due to the furious resistance of the residents of Kherson, the occupiers are attempting to introduce an administrative-police regime," it said.

151.title: Mumbai civic body begins dismantling 4 of 9 jumbo COVID-19 centres
151.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has begun the process of dismantling jumbo COVID-19 centres in Mumbai's Goregaon, Dahisar, Kanjurmarg and Mulund. The centres have begun making equipment inventories and physical dismantling of structures will soon follow, said BMC Additional Commissioner Suresh Kakani. Their equipment will be distributed to tertiary and peripheral hospitals, he added.

152.title: Russian soldier given 'wedding suit' to wear after he surrenders uniform in Ukraine
152.article_body: Ukraine Security Service has released a picture of a Russian soldier after capturing him. "The Russian invader was so eager to surrender to the Ukrainians that he surrendered not only his weapons but also his uniform. That is why he is being interrogated by the SBU in a wedding suit given to him out of pity by Ukrainians," it tweeted.

153.title: Arvind Kejriwal will be Prime Minister soon: AAP's Raghav Chadha
153.article_body: AAP MLA Raghav Chadha on Wednesday said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal "will definitely be seen in [the role of] Prime Minister soon". He added that AAP has emerged as a national political force and that it will be Congress' national and natural replacement. "Not even 10 years since AAP's inception and we're forming government in two states," he added.

154.title: Flight services from Puducherry to B'luru, Hyd to resume from Mar 27
154.article_body: The flight services from Puducherry to Bengaluru and Hyderabad would be resumed from March 27, according to a news report. A press release from the office of the Puducherry Chief Minister N Rangasamy said on Wednesday that booking of tickets to the two cities has begun. Notably, the services were suspended because of the outbreak of COVID-19.

155.title: Must be something special about turning 66: Tharoor as Shah calls to wish him on b'day
155.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said Home Minister Amit Shah called him to wish him on his birthday. "Surprised and touched to receive a telephone call from Home Minister [Amit Shah] wishing me on my birthday. There must be something special about turning 66! Most grateful for the kind words," Tharoor tweeted.

156.title: East coast floods to be declared a national emergency in Australia
156.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison on Wednesday said the floods across Australia's east coast that have killed 22 people due to heavy rains will be declared a national emergency. Morrison said the declaration will "ensure all our emergency powers are available and that we cut through any red tape we might face in delivering services and support on the ground".

157.title: Students in Ukraine didn't take advisory seriously: Piyush Goyal
157.article_body: Neither did Indian students in Ukraine take the government's advisory seriously nor did their universities allow them to leave, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said on Wednesday. He claimed 4,000 people returned before the war broke out and more could have come. "Many countries floundered in evacuating citizens from Ukraine. India still evacuated its citizens through neighbouring nations," he added.

158.title: Rahul shares pic of him having ice cream in Wayanad on Instagram
158.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday took to Instagram to share a picture of him having ice cream in his parliamentary constituency of Wayanad in Kerala. "Many flavours of Wayanad!" Rahul captioned the post. In 2018 also, Rahul was spotted in an ice cream parlour in Madhya Pradesh's Indore along with his party workers.

159.title: SII's Covovax gets emergency use nod by DCGI for adults & for children above age 12
159.article_body: Serum Institute of India's Covovax has been granted Emergency Use Authorisation by DCGI for adults and for children above the age of 12, tweeted CEO Adar Poonawalla on Wednesday. "Younger age groups will follow shortly," he added. Novavax in global trials has demonstrated more than 90% efficacy, Poonawalla's tweet read.

160.title: Kerala Cong chief's life is alms given by our party: CPI(M) leader
160.article_body: CPI(M)'s CV Varghese has triggered a controversy by saying that the life of Kerala Congress chief K Sudhakaran is "alms given by CPI(M)". "We're not interested in killing a wicked person," he said. Later, Varghese claimed Sudhakaran had defended the killers of an SFI worker. "My speech was in tune with the demands of that particular situation," he said.

161.title: Kapil Dev sent a bouquet and a small handwritten note home: Ashwin on breaking his record
161.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin, who overtook Kapil Dev to become India's second-highest Test wicket-taker, said Kapil sent a bouquet and a small handwritten congratulatory note home. He added, "Sometimes people do forget that people like Kapil Dev, Sachin Tendulkar, Anil Kumble, Harbhajan Singh, those who have done incredible things in the past are one of the reasons why I'm sitting here today."

162.title: Austria suspends its mandatory COVID-19 vaccine law
162.article_body: Austria is suspending its COVID-19 vaccine mandate which took effect as law last month. "We see no need to...implement...[law] due to...[Omicron] variant that we're predominantly experiencing here,” an Austrian minister said. The mandate required those aged 18 and above to provide proof of vaccination to authorities, a failure of which could attract fines up to €3,600 (over ₹3 lakh).

163.title: 36-year-old man runs car over pet dog in Greater Noida; arrested
163.article_body: Police have arrested a 36-year-old man for allegedly mowing down a pet dog with his car in Greater Noida. A police spokesperson said, "The incident [occurred] on February 28 when Zorah, the pet (Siberian husky)...was mowed down with a Toyota Innova Crysta by [the accused]." The pet's owner filed a complaint against the accused man, following which he was arrested.

164.title: SIT formed to probe triple murder case at CNG station in Gurugram
164.article_body: Gurugram's Commissioner of Police Kala Ramachandran formed a five-member Special Investigation Team (SIT) on March 4 to investigate the murder of three employees of a CNG station in Sector 31 on February 28, police said. Police stated that the SIT is headed by Assistant Commissioner of Police (Sadar) Aman Yadav and supervised by Deputy Commissioner of Police (east) Virender Vij.

165.title: Opp'n has accepted defeat that's why they're blaming EVMs: BJP leader
165.article_body: BJP leader Shrikant Sharma on Wednesday said that the Opposition has accepted their defeat in the UP Assembly elections and that's why they're blaming the electronic voting machines (EVMs). He further said that the Samajwadi Party government had only served the interests of particular castes. "People had rejected him (Akhilesh Yadav) in the 2017 elections," Sharma further said.

166.title: Pune district records 235 new COVID cases, 1 death on Tuesday
166.article_body: Maharashtra's Pune district on Tuesday recorded total 235 new COVID-19 cases and one coronavirus-related death. According to the state health department, the total new cases include 72 cases of Pune rural, 133 cases of Pune city and 30 new cases of PCMC. The district, as of Tuesday, reportedly saw the registration of 17.38 million COVID-19 vaccine doses.

167.title: Proposal to rename Delhi's Hauz Qazi Chowk as Hari Chand Verma Chowk withdrawn
167.article_body: AAP councillor Rakesh Kumar's proposal to rename Old Delhi's Hauz Qazi Chowk to Hari Chand Verma Chowk was withdrawn after uproar over social media and opposition by Delhi BJP spokesperson Praveen Shankar Kapoor. Verma was a former Congress leader and councillor. The proposal was given anticipatory approval by North Delhi Municipal Corporation mayor and BJP leader Raja Iqbal Singh.

168.title: Sri Lanka's most sacred elephant Nadungamuwa Raja dies aged 68
168.article_body: Sri Lankan authorities said a state funeral will be held for Nadungamuwa Raja, the country's most sacred elephant, which died aged 68 on Monday near Colombo. Raja was born in India in 1953 and reportedly gifted as one of two calves to a Sri Lankan monk by the King of Mysore. Raja's remains will be stuffed and preserved for posterity.

169.title: 2 Andhra men attempt to sexually assault Lithuanian tourist, arrested
169.article_body: Police have arrested two youth in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore for attempting to sexually assault a 27-year-old Lithuanian tourist. The accused, Sai Kumar, took dollars worth ₹5,000 from the woman and took her to his village promising to return the remaining money. Meanwhile, Kumar called his friend Sheikh Abid, took the tourist to a forest and tried to molest her.

170.title: Delhi experiences clear morning on Wednesday; air quality 'moderate'
170.article_body: Delhi experienced a sunny and clear morning on Wednesday, with the minimum temperature at 14.2 degrees, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). The city's air quality fell into the 'moderate' category. The air quality index (AQI) read 149 at 8 am, according to the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR).

171.title: GST authorities expand probe into alleged tax evasion by BharatPe
171.article_body: GST authorities have expanded probe into alleged tax evasion by BharatPe to include reported issuance of fake invoices by those close to the firm's ousted Co-founder Ashneer Grover, PTI reported. Bharatpe's books are now being scrutinised to check if bogus invoices were issued for services too. Grover, his wife were stripped of their positions for indulgence in alleged financial irregularities.

172.title: TMC women legislators misbehaved with me in the Assembly: WB Guv
172.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday wrote to Speaker Biman Banerjee accusing TMC's women legislators of obstructing his movement and misbehaving with him. This comes after the Governor's address was cut short as BJP MLAs created a ruckus over alleged rigging in the civic polls. In the letter, Dhankhar asked Banerjee to meet and fix responsibility for the incident.

173.title: Thought of calling him but couldn't, was shattered after death: Saba on Irrfan
173.article_body: Actress Saba Qamar said she regrets not keeping in touch with her 'Hindi Medium' co-star and late actor Irrfan Khan's family. "When his health deteriorated...I kept thinking I will call him but...I couldn't. One day I heard about him...I was devastated and shattered," she said, adding, "I realised one should avail time they have, because that time never comes back."

174.title: No candidate forced to stay in resort before Goa poll result: Cong
