174.article_body: Amid reports of Congress moving its candidates in Goa Assembly polls to a resort before poll results are announced, party leader Sunil Kauthankar said no one has been forced for it. "They voluntarily decided to stay together...Not correct to say that we are keeping a hold on our leaders because leaders have come from other states also," he added.

175.title: B'luru court rejects ED plea for proclamation order against Devas CEO
175.article_body: A special court in Bengaluru has rejected Enforcement Directorate's plea for a proclamation order against Ramachandran Vishwanathan, the CEO of Devas Multimedia. The ED had filed a money laundering case against Ramachandran following a failed 2005 satellite deal between Devas Multimedia and ISRO's commercial arm Antrix Corporation. Notably, a non-bailable warrant was issued against him last month.

176.title: Pic shows Japan's famous 'killing stone' split in half; sparks superstitions online
176.article_body: A picture of ancient rock called Sessho-seki (killing stone) located near the volcanic mountains in Japan's Nasu split into two has gone viral, sparking fear and superstitions on social media. Legend surrounding the stone states that it houses an evil spirit. "After nearly 1,000 years, the demon vixen is presumably once again on the loose," a Twitter user said.

177.title: My computer shut down while I was responding to client: Better.com worker on layoff
177.article_body: A Better.com employee named Amanda Bullard, speaking about the layoff wherein roughly 4,000 workers including her were sacked on Tuesday, shared her experience on LinkedIn. "I didn't find out through...payroll system, my bank account showing a severance check, or a phone call from HR. My computer just shut down in the middle of me responding to [a client]," she stated.

178.title: Canada will send Ukraine another shipment of military equipment: Trudeau
178.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Wednesday said that he told Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a phone call that Canada will "send Ukraine another shipment of highly-specialized military equipment". Both leaders also discussed "sanctions against Russia and humanitarian assistance for Ukraine" during the call. Trudeau said that he has also invited Zelenskyy to address the Canadian Parliament.

179.title: Paytm Payments Bank may ask RBI for SFB licence by June: Report
179.article_body: Paytm Payments Bank is likely to apply to the RBI for a small finance bank (SFB) licence by June, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. "I think (the application for SFB licence will be moved) sometime around May-June next fiscal year," a source was quoted as saying. The bank had received a Scheduled Bank status from RBI last year.

180.title: Pune man cheated of ₹4.9 lakh by fraudster posing as bank employee
180.article_body: A 50-year-old man in Pune was cheated of ₹4.9 lakh by a fraudster posing as an employee of a nationalised bank. The accused allegedly called the victim and asked him to share a one-time password (OTP) on the pretext of helping the latter link his PAN card to his bank account. The man lost the money after sharing the OTP.

181.title: Soldier who had come home on leave goes missing from J&K's Budgam
181.article_body: A soldier of J&K Light Infantry regiment, who had come home on leave, went missing from his village in Kashmir's Budgam district. Police confirmed Sameer Malla has been missing since Monday afternoon when he went out to visit a neighbouring village. "We are looking for him," said Budgam SP, who did not rule out the possibility of Malla being abducted.

182.title: Ex-NSE official Anand Subramanian sent to 14-day judicial custody
182.article_body: Former NSE Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian has been sent to 14-day judicial custody by a CBI court in connection with the NSE co-location case. Subramanian is the "yogi" who guided the actions of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramakrishna, reports said quoting CBI sources. A Delhi court on Monday also granted seven-day custodial interrogation of Ramakrishna to the CBI.

183.title: Musk posts old meme linking Samsung, Toshiba, Nakamichi & Motorola to Bitcoin creator
183.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk shared an old meme speculating that Satoshi Nakamoto is derived from the names of Samsung, Toshiba, Nakamichi Corp and Motorola. Satoshi Nakamoto is the pseudonym of the developer of Bitcoin whose true identity is unknown. Dogecoin's creator Billy Markus joked, "The creator of Bitcoin is half Japanese, a quarter Korean and a quarter American."

184.title: Maybe after 5-10 yrs people will say we were one of the good teams: Ashwin
184.article_body: India's Ravichandran Ashwin, who recently became India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket, has said he's looking to get better every day and enjoying this phase of his career. "I can see the kind of people I brushed shoulders with...Maybe 5-10 years down the line, people will talk about this being one of the good teams India has produced," he stated.

185.title: I used to bowl medium pace to become the next Kapil Dev: Ashwin
185.article_body: Having surpassed Kapil Dev's tally of 434 wickets in Tests to become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Tests, Ravichandran Ashwin said, "I used to bowl medium pace...so that I can...[become] the next Kapil paaji." "Even in my wildest dreams, I never thought of going past his tally. I always wanted to be a batsman especially when I started off," added Ashwin.

186.title: Centre plans to introduce regional languages in law courses
186.article_body: The Centre is planning to introduce regional languages as the medium of instruction in law courses in colleges across the country. UGC chairperson Jagadesh Kumar said, "Law is one area where our students will benefit if they study in regional languages." "We are discussing this with the vice-chancellors of national universities and other educational institutions," he added.

187.title: Finance Minister Sitharaman interacts with entrepreneurs in Bengaluru
187.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday interacted with leading entrepreneurs of IT/BT, Startups and Semiconductor sectors in Bengaluru, a press release said. Expressing her gladness over the Startup ecosystem of Karnataka, she said Karnataka sets an example to be emulated by others. She added, "We should make most of the economic opportunities that exist in the semiconductor sector."

188.title: Liquor sale banned in UP tomorrow in view of counting of votes
188.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Excise Department said on Wednesday that the sale and operations of liquor will be prohibited in the state tomorrow, March 10, in view of counting of votes. "Action to be taken in case of violation," it added. Separately, UP ADG (Law and Order) Prashant Kumar said 70,000 civil police workers will be deployed tomorrow.

189.title: EC orders action against Varanasi officer over EVMs' transportation
189.article_body: The Election Commission on Wednesday directed UP CEO to take action against Varanasi ADM NK Singh over the alleged violation of rules while transporting EVMs for training purposes. "UP CEO to proceed accordingly," EC said. On Tuesday, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav alleged EVMs were being transported in Varanasi without the knowledge of candidates and claimed SP workers intercepted a truck.

190.title: Akhilesh speaks without logic: UP Minister on SP chief's EVM remark
190.article_body: Reacting to Samajwadi Party (SP) supremo Akhilesh Yadav's allegations of EVM tampering, Uttar Pradesh Minister Mohsin Raza said on Wednesday that Yadav's remarks lack logic. "It is sad to question the working of ECI. Indirectly, they (SP) are accepting their defeat by questioning the EVMs," Raza added. Yadav had alleged on Tuesday that EVMs were being stolen in Varanasi.

191.title: Brazilian club's mascot banned for 1 game for 'intimidatory' gesture
191.article_body: The mascot of Brazilian league champions Atletico Mineiro which is a man-sized chicken has been banned for one game, by the Minas Gerais state football federation due to "intimidatory" behaviour. The mascot ran to prevent one of the Cruzeiro players from celebrating in front of fans, during the derby match last weekend against Atletico Mineiro.

192.title: Bring special law against paper leaks or face mass protest: Hardik Patel
192.article_body: Gujarat Congress working president Hardik Patel on Wednesday demanded a special law against question paper leaks and threatened to launch a mass agitation in Gandhinagar on March 28 if the government doesn't act. "There have been paper leaks in over 20 government recruitment exams in the past few years," he said while asking the youth to join protest in Gandhinagar.

193.title: Thieves break into policeman's house in Maha, steal valuables worth ₹1 lakh
193.article_body: Unidentified men allegedly broke into a policeman's house in Sarda Nagari area of Maharashtra's Beed district and stole valuables worth ₹1.26 lakh, police said on Wednesday. According to police, Assistant Police Inspector (API) Ravindra Shinde's family had travelled to Beed city on March 4. However, on their return the family found that their house had been broken into, police added.

194.title: Size doesn't matter: Mahindra on China's defence budget being 3 times that of India
194.article_body: After China announced its 2022 defence budget of $230 billion, which is three times that of India's, businessman Anand Mahindra said, "Size doesn't matter. The future of warfare will be different." Ukraine's armed drones are playing havoc with convoys of tanks, he tweeted. "It's not how much we spend but how smartly we spend that will matter," Mahindra added.

195.title: Whenever Ranveer meets my parents, he tells them 'I'm proud of her': Deepika
195.article_body: Speaking about her husband-actor Ranveer Singh, actress Deepika Padukone said, "Ranveer is definitely my cheerleader...but it's not just on social media, it's at home, too, like when I try my hand...[in] cooking a meal." She added he's an emotional and sensitive person. "Even when he meets my parents, he always tells them how proud he is of me," she said.

196.title: 62-yr-old watchman beaten to death in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
196.article_body: A 62-year-old watchman was allegedly beaten to death in the premises of Girja Dayal College in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on Tuesday. Police rushed to the college after his body lying in a pool of blood was found inside the premises. "The guard has been murdered by beating, an investigation is being done," police said.

197.title: Israel will pay for Syria attack that killed 2 Revolutionary Guards: Iran
197.article_body: Iran on Wednesday said that Israel "will pay the price" for the Syrian airstrike in which four people, including two Iranian Revolutionary Guards officers, were killed. According to the British-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, Monday's attack was the seventh Israeli strike on Syria this year, and the target was a weapon and ammunition depot near Damascus airport.

198.title: Live bat flies inside theatre during 'The Batman' screening in US, video goes viral
198.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a live bat flying inside a theatre in US during a screening of the movie 'The Batman'. Reacting to the video shared by a moviegoer, a user tweeted, "You sure you didn’t pay for the 3D version?" Another user wrote, "The bat deserves to watch the movie too."

199.title: Anmol & I got married in 2014; kept it a secret because of my career: Amrita
199.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao and her husband, radio jockey Anmol revealed in a new video that they tied the knot in a secret wedding in 2014. She said the wedding was kept a secret to make sure the news doesn't hamper her career. Amrita also revealed that they couldn't invite their cousins to the wedding because it was hidden from media.

200.title: People said 'Why would audiences see a pregnant woman in theatres?’: Vidya
200.article_body: Discussing her 2012 film 'Kahaani', actress Vidya Balan said, "[People] were like 'Why would audiences want to see a pregnant woman in theatres?'." "[Director] Sujoy Ghosh came to me with a script I didn't want to do but he [said]...he would keep coming...till I said yes," added Vidya. "I wasn't [willing to do] 'Kahaani'," stated her co-star Nawazuddin Siddiqui.

201.title: CAIT calls CCI 'spineless' for dropping probe against Amazon
201.article_body: CAIT has called the CCI "spineless" and "toothless" for dropping its investigation against Amazon. The investigation was looking into allegations that Amazon copied products of rival manufacturers and used its internal data to boost product lines. CAIT National President BC Bhartia and Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said it's highly unfortunate CCI has dropped such an investigation.

202.title: Ex-PM Raijv Gandhi’s assassination convict gets bail after 32 years in jail
202.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday granted bail to one of the convicts of former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi's assassination. AG Perarivalan, who was sentenced to life imprisonment, has spent 32 years in jail. The court took into account Perarivalan's conduct in jail, his health and that he has spent more than 30 years in prison.

203.title: Pune police adds new member to K9 dog squad, seek a name for it
203.article_body: The Pune Police announced the arrival of a new member to their K9 dog unit's bomb detection squad on Wednesday and sought a name for the dog on Twitter. The new dog is from the Labrador retriever breed. The force has a sanctioned strength of nine dogs, of which four retired after completing their 10 years of service in February.

204.title: Don't remember the last time we saw match like 1st Pak-Aus Test: Inzamam
204.article_body: Criticising the wicket used in the Rawalpindi Test against Australia, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said he doesn't even remember the last time when he saw a match like that. "You make turning pitch, help spinners. You utilize the home advantage, just don't make a dead pitch," he stated. "Even Australia adjusted really well to this pitch," Inzamam further said.

205.title: English batters are not ready to play Test cricket: Matt Prior
205.article_body: Discussing Day 1 of the opening Test between West Indies and England which saw England reduced to 48/4 at one point, ex-England wicketkeeper Matt Prior said the English batters aren't ready to play Tests. "Too many of them have some basic flaws," added Prior. Jonny Bairstow scored an unbeaten 109 to help England finish Day 1 on 268/6.

206.title: Bengal CM Mamata shares stage with Prashant Kishor amid rift rumours
206.article_body: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee shared stage with poll strategist Prashant Kishor and was seen interacting with him at a TMC meeting in Kolkata on Tuesday amid speculation of a rift. TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee was also present there. "There were certain reports of brewing differences between I-PAC and TMC. But nothing is static in politics," TMC leader Sudip Bandyopadhyay said.

207.title: Odisha college ex-principal held after assets worth more than ₹5 cr found
207.article_body: A former college principal of Biswanathpur's Hira Nila College was arrested in Odisha's Kalahandi district on Tuesday in a disproportionate assets case. This comes after Vigilance Directorate found assets worth more than ₹5 crore in his possession. The officials had conducted searches at five places on Monday. ₹1.94 lakh cash was recovered, among other things, from the accused.

208.title: My ex-boyfriend made me feel like sh*t; I was having sex with a gay man: Saisha
208.article_body: In a recent episode of 'Lock Upp', contestant Saisha Shinde spoke about the time she faced mental abuse in her past relationship. Saisha said, "He made me feel like I'm sh*t. He used to stand outside my door and...wait...that someone will come and I'll cheat." "I was a woman inside who was having sex with a gay man," Saisha added.

209.title: Mumbai Police bid final adieu to bomb squad dog with gun salute
209.article_body: A bomb squad dog named Simba passed away on Friday after serving Mumbai Police for nine years. The canine was given a state funeral at the veterinary hospital in Parel. "A Three Gun Salute For Our Best...You were the best companion and protector we could ever ask for," Mumbai Police tweeted while sharing a video of Simba's funeral.

210.title: Herzog becomes 1st Israeli leader to visit Turkey in 14 years
210.article_body: Israeli President Isaac Herzog is set to visit Turkey on Wednesday, becoming first Israeli leader to visit in 14 years, as both countries seek to normalise relations. Herzog is scheduled to hold talks with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdoğan in capital Ankara and also meet the Jewish community in Istanbul. Both countries had expelled their respective ambassadors in 2018.

211.title: Wrong window: Kajol to fan who asked when she'll work with SRK in Johar's film
211.article_body: Actress Kajol recently conducted an Ask Me Anything session on Instagram on the occasion of Women's Day. During the session, a user questioned Kajol when she would be seen in a Karan Johar movie with actor Shah Rukh Khan. Kajol responded, "That is Karan's pledge to take, wrong window, guys!"

212.title: Akhilesh should be put behind bars for spreading rumours about EVMs: BJP MP
212.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav should be put behind the bars for spreading rumours that the UP government is "stealing" EVMs, BJP Rajya Sabha MP, Harnath Singh Yadav, said. "According to the IPC, spreading rumours, misleading the public and giving wrong information come under the category of serious offences and Akhilesh Yadav is committing such crimes indiscriminately," Harnath added.

213.title: Over 75% youth in 15-18 age group received 1st COVID vaccine dose: Govt
213.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Wednesday said that over 75% of youth between the 15-18 age group have received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. He said, "Massive participation from Young India has significantly strengthened the world's largest vaccination drive." India has administered 5,55,80,872 first dose of COVID-19 vaccines in this age group as on Wednesday morning, data showed.

214.title: She'll come good soon: Jhulan on Shafali getting out for 2 ducks in last 3 ODIs
214.article_body: India Women pacer Jhulan Goswami has backed 18-year-old batter Shafali Verma, who has registered two ducks in her last three ODI innings, to do well in upcoming matches. "Shafali is batting well in the nets, she is hitting the ball really well. She is just one big knock away…I am sure she is going to do well," added Jhulan.

215.title: Even mild COVID-19 can cause brain to shrink: Oxford University study
215.article_body: COVID-19 can cause the brain to shrink up to 2%, reduce grey matter in regions controlling emotion and memory, and damage areas controlling the sense of smell, an Oxford University study has found. The scientists said the effects were even seen in people who had mild COVID-19. Whether the impact can be partially reversed or not needs more investigation.

216.title: Sanctions on Russia unlikely to affect our defence sector: NITI Aayog member
216.article_body: Sanctions imposed on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine are unlikely to affect India's defence imports, NITI Aayog member VK Saraswat said on Wednesday. He added that Russia possesses inherent military strength and is self-sufficient in military equipment manufacturing. "The reserve is very high. These kinds of short-term sanctions are not likely to create any problems for India," he said.

217.title: Flipping wrong switch caused Taiwan outage, not hackers: Govt report
217.article_body: An operator at the Hsinta coal-fired power plant in Kaohsiung in Taiwan flipped a switch marked 'Do Not Operate' that eventually led to blackouts across multiple regions, including the capital Taipei, a government investigation found. It was earlier speculated that the island's grid had been targeted in a cyberattack.The outage hit around 55 lakh homes.

218.title: Had said no to 'Jalsa', didn't have guts; COVID changed something: Vidya
218.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan who will be seen in 'Jalsa', said she had refused to do the movie and that she did not have "guts to do it". "Then one day when Suresh [Triveni] told me...he reworked script, I said I'd like to hear it again...I read and I was like, 'I am on'," the 'Shaadi Ke Side Effects' actress said.

219.title: Tick saliva drugs can replace painkillers, ease itching in people: Study
219.article_body: Votucalis, a protein found in tick saliva, can be used to make a drug that can replace painkillers and ease itching in people, as per research published in Frontiers in Pharmacology journal. The saliva of brown-ear tick, Rhipicephalus appendiculatus, contains protein that binds with histamine, preventing it from activating cell surface receptors, thereby reducing itching or chronic pain responses.

220.title: SC extends interim relief to ex-Mumbai Police chief Param Bir Singh
220.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday extended the interim protection from the arrest granted to ex-Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh in a case related to the allegation of misconduct and corruption. The bench of Justices SK Kaul and MM Sundresh said that the interim order will continue till March 24.

221.title: How are EVMs taken to strong rooms after polling & secured before counting?
221.article_body: After polling at booths, presiding officers prepare an account of votes recorded in the electronic voting machines and give attested copies to each candidate's polling agent. EVMs are then sealed and candidates travel behind vehicles carrying EVMs to strong rooms. The strong rooms are sealed and can't be opened until the morning of counting day, with security forces deployed there.

222.title: Not trying to overthrow Ukraine government: Russia
222.article_body: Amid its invasion of Ukraine, Russia has said that it is not trying to overthrow the country's government. Russia further said that "some progress" is being made in talks with Ukraine. Last month, a senior official of US Department of Defence had said that Russia has "every intention" of overthrowing the Ukrainian government.

223.title: Hardeep Puri inaugurates 3 community centres in Delhi's Rohini
223.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday inaugurated three air-conditioned community centres in Rohini Sector 7, 8 and 15 in Delhi. "The hard work of BJP MLAs, MPs and Councillors is ushering an era of inclusive development in Delhi," Puri tweeted. "The politics of laying foundation stones...replaced by the policy of completing projects on time and within budgets," he added.

224.title: Fire at B'desh Rohingya camp kills 6-yr-old boy, leaves 2,000 homeless
224.article_body: A six-year-old boy has been killed and about 2,000 people have been left homeless following a fire at a Kutupalong refugee camp in Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh, on Tuesday, authorities said. This is reportedly the sixth fire this year to hit the world's biggest refugee camp. A massive fire in January had destroyed 1,200 shelters and left over 5,000 people homeless.

225.title: UP polls last chance for people to save democracy: Akhilesh Yadav
225.article_body: Ahead of the UP Assembly polls results, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said that the state elections are the "last chance to save democracy" and after this people will have to "launch a movement" to bring change. He also alleged EVM tampering in the state and said "we may go to court". "We need to save our votes," he added.

226.title: Tiger kills man in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni; body found in pieces
226.article_body: A tiger killed a man who had gone to graze his cattle in a forest in the Seoni district of Madhya Pradesh, a forest official said on Wednesday. Following the incident, the local residents found a few pieces of his body in the forest. Proceedings were being made to provide financial assistance to the deceased's relatives, the forest official added.

227.title: DTC bus depot to be constructed in Savda Ghevra resettlement colony
227.article_body: The Delhi government has decided to construct a DTC bus depot in Savda Ghevra resettlement colony to boost connectivity with central and east Delhi areas. "Once this depot will be ready, 200 buses will start from this resettlement colony," a senior transport official said. The Public Works Department (PWD) has issued tenders for the construction of the depot.

228.title: Webcast vote counting process, share link with parties: SP to EC
228.article_body: Ahead of the counting of votes for recently-concluded UP Assembly polls on Thursday, Samajwadi Party wrote to the Chief Election Commissioner demanding webcasting of the counting process in all constituencies. SP demanded that the link must be shared with all political parties. Earlier, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav had alleged that EVMs were being transported without parties' knowledge in UP.

229.title: 5 minor girls raped & forced into flesh trade in Mumbai, man booked
229.article_body: A 50-year-old man was booked for allegedly raping five minor girls, four of whom are sisters, and forcing them into flesh trade in Mumbai. The incident came to light after a 17-year-old girl, who was rescued from a brothel two years ago, spoke about it. The crime happened from 2018-21 in Chembur. Police said the accused will be arrested soon.

230.title: Ex-Goldman banker faked ex-wife's email account to lie to girlfriend
230.article_body: Former Goldman Sachs banker Tim Leissner has detailed how he used his ex-wife's email to lie to his former girlfriend, Kimora Lee Simmons. Leissner, a key witness against former Goldman banker Roger Ng in the 1MDB scandal, posed as Judy Chan to convince Simmons the two were no longer married. Leissner was questioned about the phoney account by Ng's lawyer.

231.title: Latest rankings for Test batters out, Virat Kohli overtakes Rohit Sharma
231.article_body: The ICC today announced the latest rankings for Test batters, with former India captain Virat Kohli overtaking India captain Rohit Sharma. Virat Kohli jumped two spots to be ranked fifth, while Rohit Sharma dropped a place to be ranked sixth. Rishabh Pant moved into the top 10 after jumping one spot.

232.title: Don't rush: TMC to Meghalaya CM Sangma on border pact with Assam
232.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) asked Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma not to rush into a border pact with Assam. "I'd like to appeal to the government to hold on, have a more exhaustive understanding about this...issue," TMC's Mukul Sangma said. This comes after Conrad Sangma said that 30 of the 36 disputed villages along the Meghalaya-Assam border will remain in Meghalaya.

233.title: Sensex ends 1,223 points higher at 54,647 ahead of assembly poll results
233.article_body: The Sensex ended 1,223 points or over 2% higher at 54,647 on Wednesday, a day ahead of five state assembly election results. The broader Nifty 50 also jumped 332 points or 2% to close at 16,345. The benchmark indices ended in the green for the second straight day. Reliance Industries, Asian Paints, Bajaj Finance were among top Sensex gainers.

234.title: 'Is she man or woman': Kerala tribal activist alleges verbal abuse on train
234.article_body: Malayali tribal activist Dayabai has alleged that she faced verbal abuse by her co-passengers on a train from Ernakulam to Rajkot. Dayabai reportedly heard a co-passenger, talking on the phone, say, "Look at her face, is she a man or a woman?" When she complained about too much noise in the train, the co-passengers said she should have taken flight.

235.title: India is one of those countries which will decide fate of this century: Ukrainian MP
235.article_body: Ukraine's youngest MP Sviatoslav Yurash said India is one of those countries which will decide fate of this century. "As far as Indian position on Russian relationship is concerned, we're thankful for the call PM Modi made to our President. We're thankful for humanitarian steps India...has been making," he added. Sviatoslav further said "Russia needs to be punished by India".

236.title: Karnataka's Shobha Gasti, Nivruti Rai honoured by President Kovind
236.article_body: On International Women's Day, President Ram Nath Kovind presented Nari Shakti Puraskar to Shobha Gasti and Nivruti Rai from Karnataka along with 29 other women for their contribution in various fields. While Gasti was honoured for her work towards women and girls' empowerment, Nivruti Rai, Country Head, Intel India, was honoured for her outstanding contribution in the field of technology.

237.title: Hyd may see traffic curbs during Assembly session from March 9-15
237.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police has issued an advisory in view of the ongoing Telangana Legislative Assembly session. The police said that traffic may be stopped or diverted from March 9 to March 15 in some routes. The areas where traffic congestion is likely include Telugu Thalli – Iqbal Minar – Ravindra Bharathi route.

238.title: 1 killed, 13 injured in explosion in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur
238.article_body: At least one person was killed and 13 others were injured following an explosion near the Tehsildar office in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur on Wednesday. "Exact cause...of the blast being worked out...too early to draw any definite conclusion," BJP leader Dr Jitendra Singh said. "Injured being moved to hospital. I'm in touch with DC Smt Indu Chib," he tweeted.

239.title: Noida woman jumps to death from 26th floor as she failed to clear UPSC
239.article_body: A 31-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide after jumping from the 26th floor of a building in Noida. Police said the woman, who'd previously worked at State Bank of India, had quit her job to prepare for the UPSC exam. However, she reportedly failed to clear it and became depressed, police added. Her mother was at home when this happened.

240.title: Land unavailable for making parking space for vehicles: Pune Metro
240.article_body: After commuters complained of parking issues near the newly operational Pune Metro, MahaMetro, which is implementing the project, said that land for making parking space for vehicles is not available. "There is a paucity of land along the Pune-Mumbai highway for developing parking space," its spokesperson said. He added, "If we get the land, we will set up parking lots."

241.title: Cabinet approves SPV for sale of surplus govt land and buildings
241.article_body: The Union Cabinet has approved setting up of the National Land Monetisation Corporation (NLMC), a special purpose vehicle (SPV) to handle the sale of surplus government land and buildings. NLMC's board will include senior central government officers and eminent experts. In addition to selling surplus land and buildings, NLMC will own and manage surplus assets of central PSUs under closure.

242.title: Musk seeks to end SEC deal requiring his tweets to be pre-approved
242.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has asked a federal judge to terminate his 2018 agreement with the US SEC requiring some of his tweets to be vetted by a lawyer. "The SEC's pursuit...has crossed the line into harassment, which is quintessential bad faith," lawyers said. The decree was signed in 2018 after Musk's "funding secured" tweet on taking Tesla private.

243.title: Mumbai Police detains Fadnavis over protest demanding Nawab's resignation
243.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM and senior BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis was detained by Mumbai Police for allegedly participating in a protest demanding NCP leader and Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's resignation. Malik was arrested by ED over an alleged money laundering case linked to underworld don Dawood Ibrahim. Fadnavis was seen clenching his fist while he was being taken away by police.

244.title: Ravindra Jadeja becomes world number one all-rounder in Test cricket
244.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has become the world number one all-rounder in Test cricket after jumping two spots in the latest ICC rankings. This comes after Jadeja scored 175*(228) and took nine wickets in the first Test against Sri Lanka. Jadeja is on top with 406 rating points. Ravichandran Ashwin is ranked third.

245.title: Ukraine's air defences having success against Russian jets: UK
245.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry on Wednesday said Ukraine's air defences have "enjoyed considerable success against Russia's modern combat aircraft". This has likely prevented Moscow from achieving "any degree of control of the air", it added. According to UK's Defence Intelligence report, fighting in Kyiv's northwest region is ongoing but Russian forces have failed to make "any significant breakthroughs".

246.title: SAT declines to stay SEBI order directing Dish TV to disclose AGM results
246.article_body: Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) has declined to stay SEBI's order directing Dish TV to disclose voting results of its annual general meeting (AGM). SAT has also directed Dish TV to file its reply in the matter against SEBI's order by March 20.  SEBI passed the order after receiving complaints from Yes Bank and other Dish TV shareholders.

247.title: Small Ukrainian boy cries as he walks to Poland border; video surfaces
247.article_body: A video of a small Ukrainian boy crying while walking to Poland border amid war is being widely shared online. The video shows the boy dragging his belongings in a bag while crying loudly. While the child appears to be alone in the video, reports claimed he was walking behind his mother.

248.title: Partnership in middle crucial: Bairstow on ton after Eng were 48/4 vs WI
248.article_body: England batter Jonny Bairstow, who is currently unbeaten at 109, has said partnerships through the middle of their innings on Day 1 in the ongoing Test against West Indies were crucial. England were 48/4 when Bairstow came in to bat and added 67 runs with Ben Stokes for the fifth wicket. He then added 99 runs with Ben Foakes.

249.title: PMC to start classes for 1st batch of MBBS at new medical college
249.article_body: After receiving approval from National Medical Commission(NMC), Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is set to start classes for first batch of 100 MBBS students at its new medical college. The Bharat Ratna Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical College will commence classes from December this year, PMC Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said. The college will be under Maharashtra University of Health Sciences, Nashik.

250.title: I wanted to spend money on my body after being skin-shamed: Tejasswi
250.article_body: Speaking about dealing with body-shaming, actress Tejasswi Prakash said she used to feel bad at that time. She added, "I was...receiving negative comments because I was underweight." Tejasswi added she wanted to spend money on her body after she was called out for being skinny. "It was...tempting but then I told myself...if I...change myself, I'm no different," she added.

251.title: 35 MP natives stuck at Ukraine's Sumy likely to return tonight: State govt
251.article_body: Nearly 35 natives of Madhya Pradesh stuck in Ukraine's Sumy city have left the country and are likely to reach India by tonight, state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said on Wednesday. "All are safe...and...in touch with their family members," Mishra added. The MP government had announced that it will arrange for stay, food and transportation of students returning from Ukraine.

252.title: China to send humanitarian aid worth 5 million yuan to Ukraine
252.article_body: The Chinese Red Cross will send humanitarian assistance worth 5 million yuan (over ₹6 crore) to Ukraine, said the Chinese foreign ministry on Wednesday. The announcement comes amid the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, which has resulted in lakhs of Ukrainians fleeing the country. The country is also facing shortage of food, water and electricity.

253.title: Father, his sons arrested for kidnapping student, demanding ₹7 lakh in B'luru
253.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a father, his sons for allegedly abducting a 21-year-old student from his residence and demanding a ransom of ₹7 lakh. The kidnappers earlier used to be neighbours of the student and were aware that his mother had received a share of his father's ancestral property after his death, which was sold last year, the police said.

254.title: Pune govt hospital superintendent demands bribe from pvt doctor, held
254.article_body: The medical superintendent of a sub-district hospital in Bhor taluka in Pune district has been booked for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹10,000 from a private doctor. The 60-year-old accused had demanded the bribe for not giving a negative report about the sonography centre in the hospital run by the doctor. The accused was nabbed while accepting ₹5,000 on Tuesday.

255.title: US man caught smuggling 52 lizards, snakes in packets hidden in his clothes
255.article_body: A 30-year-old man from the US was caught trying to smuggle as many as 52 reptiles including 43 horned lizards and nine snakes at a border crossing with Mexico. According to customs officials, the man, who was driving a truck, kept the reptiles tied up in small bags which were hidden in his jacket, pants pockets and groin area.

256.title: Mumbai court sentences man to 5-yr-jail for daughter-in-law's suicide
256.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai sentenced an 82-year-old man to five years of rigorous imprisonment for allegedly abetting the suicide of his daughter-in-law 11 years ago. The court noted that he repeatedly abused her in a drunken state and threatened to kill her. "It is not expected by any daughter-in-law that she would be given such inhuman treatment," it added.

257.title: Australian Army Chief pays respects at National War Memorial in Delhi
257.article_body: Chief of Australian Army, Lieutenant General Rick Burr, paid his respects to the martyred Indian soldiers and laid a wreath at the National War Memorial in Delhi on Wednesday. Burr, who is on a two-day visit to India, was received by the Army Chief General Manoj Mukund Naravane. He was also given a Guard of Honour at the South Block.

258.title: Pics of crowds at Soviet Union's 1st McDonald's surface as firm shuts Russian shops
258.article_body: Pictures showing long queues outside Soviet Union's first McDonald's on its opening day surfaced online after the company temporarily shut restaurants in Russia. The first McDonald's opened in Moscow's Pushkin Square in 1990, symbolising the opening of USSR to the West. "I stood in line for...an hour to get a cheeseburger in 1990...It's a sad day," a Twitter user said.

259.title: ICC announces Player of the Month nominations for February, 3 Indians included
259.article_body: ICC has announced Player of the Month nominations for February, with three Indians included across the two categories. Shreyas Iyer, who won Player of the Series award for scoring three unbeaten fifties against Sri Lanka in T20Is, has been nominated in men's category, while Mithali Raj and Deepti Sharma have been nominated for ICC Women's Player of the Month award.

260.title: National agencies get trained by BJP, fabricate cases: Raut
260.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said national agencies like NCB, CBI and ED get trained by BJP and fabricate cases, not Maharashtra Police. "False cases are never filed against anybody in Maharashtra," he added. Referring to Ex-Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis' claims that Maharashtra government is working to frame BJP leaders, Raut said, "His sensational remarks are maligning state police."

261.title: Global carbon dioxide emissions reach highest level in history: Experts
261.article_body: The global emission of carbon dioxide (CO2) has reached its highest levels in history, experts said. CO2 emissions rose by 6% in 2021 to 36.3 billion metric tons, a report stated. During pandemic, carbon emission declined due to lesser consumption of fossil fuels but as the world economy rebounded post-COVID with heavy reliance on fossil fuels, CO2 emissions surged massively.

262.title: Russia claims Ukraine was planning to attack Donbass in March, shares 'secret' document
262.article_body: Russian foreign ministry shared a 'secret' document it allegedly acquired during special military operation in Ukraine. "Classified documents (order by Commander National Guard of Ukraine) confirm...Kiev regime was covertly preparing an offensive operation against Donbass [in] March 2022," it wrote. Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists have been fighting in Donbass since 2014.

263.title: Why did US reject Poland's offer to provide its MiG-29 jets to Ukraine?
263.article_body: The US rejected Poland's offer to transfer its MiG-29 jets to a base in Germany to be provided to Ukraine in the war against Russia. The Pentagon said the prospect of flying combat aircraft from NATO territory into the war zone "raises serious concerns for the entire NATO alliance". NATO has said it does not want direct conflict with Russia.

264.title: More military at India & China borders increases risk of armed confrontation: US
264.article_body: The annual threat assessment of the US Intelligence Community stated that expanded military posture by both India and China along the disputed border elevates the risk of armed confrontation between two nuclear powers. It added that this "might involve direct threats to US persons and interests and calls for US intervention." It also said that Indo-China relations will remain strained.

265.title: Next generation bowlers can forget about 1000 int'l wickets: Ashwin on Warne
265.article_body: India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has said that the next generation of bowlers can forget about getting 1000+ international wickets, a record held by Shane Warne, who passed away last week, and Muttiah Muralitharan. "[Because] the volume of Test cricket will come down drastically. And also because there are so many leagues, workload management will take centre-stage," Ashwin explained.

266.title: Girl who sells balloons in Kerala turns model, makeover pics go viral
266.article_body: A balloon seller from Kerala has gone viral after photos of her makeover were posted online. The girl named Kisbu was selling balloons near a temple when she was spotted by photographer Arjun Krishnan, who took a few pictures of the teenager, one of which he posted on Instagram. It went viral and led to Kisbu starring in a photoshoot.

267.title: No 4th COVID wave in India unless a differently-behaving variant comes up: Virologist
267.article_body: Virologist Dr T Jacob John has said he is "fairly confident" that no fourth COVID-19 wave will occur in India unless an unexpected variant that behaves differently comes up. John, the former director of Indian Council for Medical Research's Centre of Advanced Research in Virology, said it can be confidently concluded that the third COVID-19 wave has ended.

268.title: Bumble removes all its dating apps from Russia & Belarus
268.article_body: Bumble is discontinuing its operations in Russia and removing all of its dating apps from Apple App Store and Google Play Store in Russia and Belarus. Bumble expects losing about $20 million in revenue in 2022 from this move. The combined revenue from Russia, Ukraine and Belarus was approximately 2.8% of its total revenue in 2021, mostly from Badoo app.

269.title: Bengaluru police shoot 2 murder accused in leg after they attack police
269.article_body: Bengaluru police on Wednesday allegedly opened fire to arrest two people wanted in a murder case. Reportedly, the men were on a two-wheeler and upon being confronted by the police, they attacked the policemen. Police, in order to defend themselves and arrest the culprits, then fired rounds at their legs to immobilise them, Times Now reported.

270.title: Pune court denies bail to medical student in ₹10-lakh extortion case
270.article_body: A Pune court on Monday denied bail to a medical student who was arrested for allegedly extorting ₹10 lakh from an engineering student. The accused, Amar Suryakant Poul, had allegedly sought money on pretext of establishing a media office and threatened to kill the victim if he didn't comply. Notably, Poul also has other cases of cheating registered against him.

271.title: Russia, Ukraine agree on day-long evacuation corridors
271.article_body: A Ukrainian official has said that Russia and Ukraine have agreed on day-long evacuation corridors to help civilians escape the war. Thousands are thought to have died or been wounded amid the biggest attack on a European state since World War II. Earlier, at least 10 people were killed in a Russian military attack in Severodonestk.

272.title: Poland offers to place its MiG-29 jets at US disposal to be provided to Ukraine
272.article_body: Poland has said that it is ready to deploy its MiG-29 jets to Ramstein Air Base in Germany and put them at US disposal for them to be provided to Ukraine. "Poland requests the US to provide us with used aircraft with corresponding operational capabilities. Poland is ready to immediately establish the conditions of purchase of the planes," it said.

273.title: Raising questions on EVM is anti-democratic: BJP to Akhilesh Yadav
273.article_body: Reacting to Akhilesh Yadav's claims of EVM tampering, the BJP said that raising questions on EVM is anti-democratic. "Akhilesh Yadav ji raising questions on EVMs is not only ridiculous but also anti-democratic. Did BJP question EVMs after defeat in Chhattisgarh, Rajasthan etc.?," BJP's Arvind Menon said. "Poor EVMs, they have to bear the brunt of Dynasts," BJP's CT Ravi said.

274.title: IPO-bound Mobikwik posts 1st-ever profit of ₹7 cr in Dec quarter
274.article_body: IPO-bound fintech firm Mobikwik recorded its first-ever profit of ₹7 crore in the December 2021 quarter after losing money in the first and second quarters. The company had achieved revenue of around ₹400 crore in the nine-month period ended December 31, an 86% growth on a year-on-year basis. It expects its full financial year of 2022-23 to be profitable.

275.title: I didn't know much English: Sushmita recalls answering Miss Universe question
275.article_body: Sushmita Sen recalled the question that led to her winning the 1994 Miss Universe pageant. Sushmita was asked, "What for you is the essence of being a woman?" In a recent interview, Sushmita revealed she was from Hindi medium school and didn't know much English at that time. "I don't know how...I answered that question with such clarity," she added.

276.title: Saw them painting faces, they broke with pain in time: Bhansali on sex workers
276.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali, while speaking to actress Alia Bhatt in an interview recalled how he saw sex workers during his childhood. "I saw them painting their faces and I saw their faces broken in time with pain. They were trying to look beautiful but looked uglier and uglier because it was distortion," Bhansali said.

277.title: Telangana govt to fill up 91,142 direct recruitment vacancies: CM KCR
277.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday announced the state government's decision to fill up 91,142 direct recruitment vacancies in the state. "The services of 11,103 contract employees working against direct recruitment vacancies will be regularised," he said. "The recruitment process for the remaining vacancies of 80,039 would be taken up immediately," Rao further said.

278.title: UP policeman congratulates BJP leader before poll results, probe ordered
278.article_body: A probe has been ordered against a policeman in Uttar Pradesh after he was seen congratulating BJP state vice-president Dayashankar Singh on becoming a cabinet minister ahead of the poll results in a video. A transfer order has also been issued for the policeman. The counting of votes of the 2022 UP Assembly elections is scheduled for March 10.

279.title: Sehwag congratulates Ashwin over 'mankading' rule change, says 'Ek karna zaroor'
279.article_body: Ex-cricketer Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to congratulate Ravichandran Ashwin after MCC removed 'mankading' from 'Unfair play' to 'Run-out' section in its laws. "Congratulations Ashwin, great week this one. First becoming second-highest [Test] wicket-taker for India...and now this. Ab full freedom to plot such run-outs with Buttler. Ek karna zaroor." Ashwin had 'mankaded' Buttler in IPL 2019.

280.title: No-confidence motion submitted against Pakistan PM to remove him from office
280.article_body: Pakistan's Opposition parties have submitted a no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan to remove him from office after holding his government responsible for the uncontrolled inflation. The motion was signed by about 100 lawmakers. Last year, Khan got 178 votes when he had decided to seek a vote of confidence after a candidate supported by his party lost Senate election.

281.title: I put on a lot of weight; was shocked to see those pics myself: Fardeen
281.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan said people were shocked to see his pictures after he put on weight. "It wasn't that I was living in denial...I was...shocked when I saw those pictures myself," he added. "You can either let it work for you or let it destroy you. I'm not one of those who sits and wallows in self-pity," Fardeen said.

282.title: Millions of children trembling at every sound: Ukrainian model Veronika
282.article_body: Talking about the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Ukrainian model Veronika Didusenko said, "Millions of Ukrainian children..., their mothers are trembling at every sound...and...more heartbreaking are those forced to give birth." "Directly above my head, dozens of...helicopters...were bombing an...airfield," added Veronika. "Cities...are on the verge of a humanitarian catastrophe," stated the model.

283.title: 3 killed after being trapped in coal mine in Telangana’s Peddapalli
283.article_body: Three people were found dead after being trapped following an accident in Singareni Collieries in Telangana's Peddapalli district, the officials said on Wednesday. The incident occurred on Monday afternoon when a portion of the roof or the side wall of the mine collapsed. Among the dead, two were company officials while one was an outsourced worker.

284.title: Mumbai woman loses ₹20,000 while trying to order wine online
284.article_body: A 24-year-old Mumbai-based woman was duped of ₹20,406 by a cyber fraudster in a wine shop-cum-Google listing fraud. According to the complainant's statement, she had ordered wine from the 'Wine and Wine' shop after looking up their number on Google. A man received the call and sent her QR codes to make the payment after which the amount was deducted.

285.title: Chhattisgarh’s GSDP estimated to grow by 11.5%, says economic survey
285.article_body: Chhattisgarh's Gross State Domestic Product (GSDP) is estimated to grow by 11.54% and the per capita income by 11.93% in the financial year 2021-22, according to the economic survey presented by the state government in the Legislative Assembly on Tuesday. The survey report was presented by Planning, Economics and Statistics Minister Amarjeet Bhagat.

286.title: What are the major announcements made in Chhattisgarh Budget 2022-23?
286.article_body: In his Budget 2022-23 speech, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Wednesday announced that the old pension scheme will be restored. "₹2 crore proposed for Chhattisgarh Rojgar Mission to work on the possibilities of creating new jobs," Baghel added. Chhattisgarh government has increased the annual assistance under Rajiv Gandhi Bhumihin Krishi Majdur Nyay Yojana from ₹6,000 to ₹7,000 from next year.

287.title: Antarctic explorer's ship found 107 years after it sank
287.article_body: The wreck of Endurance, the lost ship of Antarctic explorer Sir Ernest Shackleton, was found at the weekend at the bottom of the Weddell Sea. The ship was crushed by sea-ice and sank in 1915, forcing Shackleton and his men to escape on foot and in small boats. Its name - Endurance - is clearly visible on the stern.

288.title: CM Baghel brings briefcase made of cow dung to present Chhattisgarh Budget, shares pic
288.article_body: Chattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel walked in the Chhattisgarh Assembly carrying a briefcase made of cow dung ahead of the state Budget. The briefcase had "Gomaye Vasate Lakshmi" written on it in Sanskrit, which translates to "Goddess of wealth Laxmi resides in cow dung". Chhattisgarh government had announced in 2020 that it'll procure cow dung from cow breeders and farmers.

289.title: IndiGo, SpiceJet shares jump as ban on international flights lifted after 2 years
289.article_body: Shares of Indian airlines, including SpiceJet, IndiGo parent InterGlobe Aviation and Jet Airways, rose 5-8% each, a day after the government lifted the ban on regular international flights after two years. The Centre will resume scheduled commercial international passenger flights to and from India from March 27. Currently, international flights operate under air bubble arrangements with nations.

290.title: Security measures in place at EVM strong room: Lucknow Police Commissioner
290.article_body: There are adequate security measures in place at EVM strong room, DK Thakur, Police Commissioner, Lucknow, said on Wednesday. "Strong room will be opened at around 7 am in the presence of election observers and candidates. Counting (of votes) will begin at 8 am tomorrow. Police patrolling will be done in sensitive areas," Thakur added.

291.title: Better.com accidentally sent severance cheques a day before mass layoffs: Report
291.article_body: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com accidentally released severance payslips a day before mass layoffs were meant to be announced, TechCrunch reported citing employees. "No email, no call, nothing. This was handled disgustingly," an employee, who received a severance cheque, said. After the mistake, CFO Kevin Ryan sent an email to employees confirming the layoffs in US and India.

292.title: Not snorting drugs, leave if uncomfortable: Shweta on breastfeeding in public
292.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari said that as a mother, she enjoys breastfeeding and that if doing it in public makes anyone uncomfortable, they can "get up and go". "I'm not doing anything wrong. I'm not snorting drugs. I am feeding my hungry child," she said, adding, "It's such a taboo, airports don't have breastfeeding areas. They have smoking areas, though."

293.title: Alia in 'Gangubai...' in same league as Nargis in 'Mother India': Bhansali
293.article_body: Discussing actress Alia Bhatt's performance in his film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said he believes it is in the "same league" as late actress Nargis Dutt's performance in classic 'Mother India'. "[The] performance...will be celebrated for the next 50-100 years," added Bhansali. "It could be at par with...Meena Kumari in 'Sahib Bibi Aur Ghulam'," stated Bhansali.

294.title: I will give prize money for rest of 2022 to victims in Ukraine: Murray
294.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray tweeted that he will be donating his earnings from prize money for the rest of 2022, to victims of the Russian invasion of Ukraine. "Over 7.5 million children are at risk with the escalating conflict in Ukraine," added Murray in his tweet. "It is vital [that] education continues," stated the tennis player.

295.title: Not really happy with my performance in Ranji, 40s and 50s are nothing: Shaw
295.article_body: Indian batter Prithvi Shaw, who's leading Mumbai in the Ranji Trophy 2022, has said he's not happy with his performance in the tournament. "It should have been much better. You know 40s and 50s are nothing in cricket," he stated. Shaw produced scores of 1, 9, 44 and 53 in his four innings in three Ranji games.

296.title: 2,078 UP students stranded in Ukraine evacuated: CM Yogi Adityanath
296.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that out of the total of 2,290 students from UP studying in Ukraine, 2,078 have been safely evacuated and have returned to their respective homes. He further informed that out of 74 students from Gorakhpur, 70 have safely returned. "The rest of the students are also being brought back safely," the CM added.

297.title: IIT grads-led Money View raises $75 mn at $625 mn valuation
297.article_body: Fintech platform Money View has raised $75 million in its Series D funding from Tiger Global, Winter Capital, Evolvence India and Accel, among others. The startup is now valued at $625 million. Founded in 2014 by IIT Delhi graduates, Puneet Agarwal and Sanjay Aggarwal, Money View provides personal loans, as well as buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) products to individuals.

298.title: Sensex jumps 1,100 points a day ahead of 5 state assembly election results
298.article_body: The Sensex jumped over 1,100 points during intraday trade on Wednesday ahead of the five state assembly election results tomorrow. While the Sensex was trading above 54,500 levels, the broader Nifty 50 jumped over 300 points to trade above 16,300 levels. Earlier, exit polls predicted that AAP may win in Punjab, while BJP will retain Uttar Pradesh.

299.title: 6 labourers from Bihar drugged, robbed on train in UP
299.article_body: Six labourers from Bihar who were travelling in Bihar-bound Jannayak Express train were allegedly drugged and robbed of their luggage and valuables at Bareilly junction in Uttar Pradesh. The labourers were found in an unconscious state in a coach by a passenger who informed Government Railway Police. They were rushed to the district hospital but they haven't regained consciousness yet.

300.title: BJP, RSS have nothing to do with Nathuram Godse: Gujarat minister
300.article_body: The BJP and RSS have nothing to do with Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse, said Gujarat Cabinet Minister Purnesh Modi on Tuesday. "The Bharatiya Jana Sangh, RSS or BJP have never talked about it [association with Godse]. We have no relation with him," he said after Congress questioned the installation of Godse's bust in Jamnagar.

301.title: With 90.5% coverage, Odisha tops India's list of full immunisation
301.article_body: With 90.5% coverage, Odisha has topped the national level list of full immunisation, a senior health official confirmed on Tuesday. While 20 districts in the state have achieved above 90% full immunisation, the remaining 10 were below 90%. Full immunisation programmes refer to vaccination against 12 different diseases including polio, tuberculosis, jaundice, diphtheria and HIV among others.

302.title: Bottom line was 'Pak shouldn't lose': Shahid Afridi on Rawalpindi pitch
302.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has criticised the Rawalpindi pitch used in the first Test against Australia, stating that the upcoming games should have "good pitches". "Pakistan didn't think about Australia, the bottom line was 'we shouldn't lose'," stated Afridi. Both the teams aggregated 1,187 runs for 14 wickets in the match, which ended in a draw.

303.title: 16-yr-old boy held for creating fake FB profile of Chengalpattu Collector
303.article_body: A 16-year-old boy in Rajasthan was held for allegedly creating a fake Facebook profile of Chengalpattu District Collector, AR Rahul Nadh. On January 18, Nadh had announced on Facebook that someone had created a fake account in his name and was asking for money from the public. Nadh asked people not to accept any friend request from the profile concerned.

304.title: High command, party MLAs will decide CM: Congress poll observer in U'khand
304.article_body: Ahead of the Uttarakhand Assembly poll results, Congress poll observer Mohan Prakash said the Chief Minister will be decided by party high command and elected MLAs. "We are sure of forming government in Uttarakhand, Goa, Punjab and getting majority...in UP," Prakash added. His remarks came after Congress leader Harish Rawat said nobody has objections to his name as CM candidate.

305.title: UP Board exams for Classes 10, 12 to start from March 24; to be held offline
305.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Madhyamik Shiksha Parishad (UPMSP) has released the state Board examinations schedule for Classes 10 and 12. Class 10 exams will be conducted between March 24-April 9, and Class 12 exams will be conducted between March 24-April 12. The exams will be conducted in two shifts, from 8 am to 11:15 am and from 2 pm to 5:15 pm.

306.title: 8-yr-old died on streets, 14-yr-old hit in the head by wreckage: Ukraine's 1st Lady
306.article_body: Condemning Russia's "mass murder" of civilians in an open letter to global media, First Lady of Ukraine, Olena Zelenska, wrote, "Eight-year-old Alice...died on streets of Okhtyrka while her grandfather tried to protect her." "14-year-old Arseniy was hit in the head by wreckage, and could not be saved because an ambulance could not get to him on time," she added.

307.title: UK announces new aviation sanctions giving it power to detain Russian aircraft
307.article_body: The UK has announced new aviation sanctions giving it the power to detain any Russian aircraft. It will also strengthen its ban on Russian aircraft, making it a criminal offence for any to fly or land in the UK. The ban includes any aircraft owned, operated or chartered by anyone connected with Russia or designated individuals or entities.

308.title: Gurugram woman accuses Bihar cricket chief of trying to rape her at 5-star hotel in Delhi
308.article_body: A woman from Gurugram, who is the director of an advertisement firm, has accused Bihar Cricket Association President Rakesh Tiwary of trying to rape her at a five-star hotel in Delhi last year. She alleged that Rakesh tried to force himself on her when she had gone to meet him over pending payments. Police have filed an FIR.

309.title: Hungary will not support ban on Russian energy imports: PM Orban
309.article_body: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban said that Hungary will not support a ban on Russian oil and gas imports, saying it "would represent a disproportionately large burden" for his country. "While we condemn Russia's armed offensive and we also condemn the war, we will not allow Hungarian families to be made to pay the price of the war," he said.

310.title: 10-year-old Ukrainian girl shot dead by drunk Russian soldiers, says family
310.article_body: A 10-year-old Ukrainian girl was shot dead by drunk Russian soldiers in front of her uncle in a village near Kyiv, her family said. Russian soldiers allegedly started shooting "everywhere they could see", including in four homes, after a Ukrainian boy fired a gun in the air. The family was later forced to bury her in the yard.

311.title: Better.com is laying off 3,000 India & US workers after firing 900 on a Zoom call
311.article_body: Mortgage lending startup Better.com, which had fired 900 employees on a Zoom call, has announced that it's reducing its workforce in India and the US in a significant manner over "the coming days". A company spokesperson told TechCrunch that the number is "just over 3,000". CFO Kevin Ryan said affected employees will be eligible for 60-80 days of severance pay.

312.title: AIIMS Delhi launches app with 'panic button' for women employees
312.article_body: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Delhi has launched an "empowerment app" called the AIIMS ICC. It has reportedly been launched for women employees who feel unsafe in hospital. The app has panic button that can be used to send distress signal to hospital security team. "App can be used...as signal to initiate rescue for...female employees," release said.

313.title: 500 PCR vans deployed for women's safety: Delhi Police Commissioner
313.article_body: Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana on Tuesday said more than 500 PCR vans have been deployed near schools and colleges across the city to ensure the safety of women students. "Under our free ride scheme, distressed women are being dropped to their homes at night," the commissioner said in a podcast on the occasion of International Women's Day.

314.title: Heartened to see US ban Russian oil imports, UK must follow: Branson
314.article_body: Billionaire Richard Branson praised the US ban on Russian oil imports saying, "Heartened to see...US...ban the import of Russian oil and natural gas." "This will have an impact on remaining revenue flows to Russia," he added. Branson said UK and EU must enforce a ban too as complete economic isolation is the "only way of forcing Russia out of Ukraine".

315.title: No negativity for her: Varun Sood's dad reacts to son's breakup with Divya
315.article_body: Varun Sood's father Vineet Sood reacted to his son's breakup with Divya Agarwal and said that he respects Divya's decision. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "It's life. I have no negativity for her. She was and will continue to have my unfiltered affection and care. Cherish your times in togetherness and [we] wish her luck and God's speed in life."

316.title: Thanks for striking in heart of Putin's war machine: Zelenskyy to Biden
316.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy thanked US President Joe Biden for banning Russian oil, coal and gas from US markets in response to Moscow's ongoing invasion of Ukraine. Zelenskyy said the ban would "strike in the heart of [Russian President] Vladimir Putin's war machine". The Ukrainian President also urged other countries and leaders to do the same.

317.title: Defence Ministry seeks independent weapon testing-certification agency
317.article_body: In a move to promote 'Atmanirbharta', the Defence Ministry has approached the Union Cabinet to approve setting up of an independent body to meet testing and certification requirements of weapons developed by Indian private sector. The authority will work towards ensuring that private sector is not dependent on government for getting their equipment approved for both domestic sales and exports.

318.title: Had self doubt, was told 'mothers don't have flat stomach': Rupali on Anupamaa
318.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly said that she had self-doubts when she joined the show 'Anupamaa'. "I told our producer...let me lose some weight...[he] told me 'I want a mother and you are perfect for the role because mothers are like this. Mothers don't get time to hit gym and have perfect figure and have a flat stomach'," she added.

319.title: WI defend 9 runs in 48th over to defeat England by 7 runs in Women's WC
319.article_body: While defending nine runs, West Indies' Anisa Mohammed took a wicket and effected a run-out in the 48th over to help her team defeat England by seven runs in the ongoing ICC Women's ODI World Cup. This is West Indies' second straight victory in the tournament. WI posted 225/6 before restricting England to 218/10 in 47.4 overs.

320.title: We will make B'wood talk about us through our work: Tamil actor Suriya
320.article_body: Talking about whether he wishes to work in Bollywood, Tamil actor Suriya Sivakumar said, "We will make Bollywood talk about us [through our work]. I don't think we need to go there to prove ourselves." "If a guest comes..., we...ask our daughter to serve...and not our sons. Why does that happen? The change should start from ourselves," added Suriya.

321.title: Putin must see whole sporting world is disgusted: Ex-Ukrainian boxer Klitschko
321.article_body: Ukrainian boxing Hall of Famer Wladimir Klitschko praised the support shown by fans during Premier League matches, adding, "Please keep it going - Vladimir Putin...must see the whole sporting world is disgusted by his aggression." "Putin won't stop because of one gesture," he stated. "I have nothing personal against...[Russian] athletes but...a lot against [Putin's] aggression," said Wladimir.

322.title: Nobody thought I would be an actor: 'Baahubali' actor Prabhas
322.article_body: Actor Prabhas who played the titular character in the 'Baahubali' film franchise said "nobody" thought he would become an actor one day, adding that he has opened up having been "very shy" previously. "I got lucky with Baahubali. The pressure will always be there, suddenly a film from one state got such immense response from the whole...world," stated Prabhas.

323.title: People helped by Deol family took advantage, spoiled our names: Bobby
323.article_body: Terming the Deol family as "very simple and good", actor Bobby Deol said "many" people helped by them took their "advantage" and "spoiled" the family's name. "This keeps on happening. We aren't manipulative or street smart," added Bobby. "We were told since we were kids to be a nice human being," stated the actor.

324.title: Purnia becomes first Bihar district to launch menstrual hygiene plan
324.article_body: Purnia became the first district in Bihar to launch an action plan for menstruation hygiene management on Women's Day, officials said. The management plan first succeeded in the Kasba block, where it started as a pilot project in April 2021, Purnia DM Rahul Kumar said. NITI Aayog has also approved a proposal for toilets at 200 government schools in Purnia.

325.title: Get to bomb shelters as quickly as possible: Ukraine authorities to people in Kyiv
325.article_body: An air alert has been declared in and around the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv, with residents urged to get to bomb shelters as quickly as possible, Associated Press reported. "Threat of a missile attack," regional administration head Oleksiy Kuleba said on Telegram. Across the country, thousands of people are thought to have been killed in nearly two weeks of fighting.

326.title: We're sorry, we messed up: Flipkart on 'Get kitchen appliances' text on Women's Day
326.article_body: Flipkart has apologised after the e-commerce platform was criticised for sending a message promoting kitchen appliances on International Women's Day 2022. "Dear Customer, This Women's Day, let's celebrate You. Get Kitchen Appliances from ₹299," the message read. "We messed up and we're sorry. We did not intend to hurt anyone's sentiments," Flipkart wrote on its official Twitter account.

327.title: 60-year-old former IB officer allegedly rapes 17-year-old girl in Delhi hotel
327.article_body: Delhi Police are searching for a 60-year-old retired officer of the Intelligence Bureau (IB) who allegedly raped a 17-year-old girl at a hotel on Monday. Police said the accused knew the victim and her family and he had called the girl on the pretext of giving her a job. "He has switched off his phone and is absconding," police added.

328.title: Amazon-backed Rivian sued over misleading investors about EV prices
328.article_body: Amazon-backed Rivian has been sued in the US by a shareholder Charles Larry Crews who claimed it failed to tell investors it had underpriced its electric vehicles. Crews said Rivian hid that its R1S SUV and R1T pickup truck were so underpriced that it needed to raise prices soon after its November IPO. The lawsuit names more than 30 defendants.

329.title: Don't bring caste consideration in admission to military schools: SC
329.article_body: Rejecting a plea for caste reservations in admission to military schools, the Supreme Court said that India's armed forces are a "homogenous unit" that should not be divided on the basis of caste. "You cannot have caste reservation in military schools...We're focussed on gender issues and would not want you to divide it into other issues of caste," SC added.

330.title: Opinion polls & exit polls should be banned: Sukhbir Badal
330.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal on Wednesday said that opinion polls and exit polls should be banned. "I think no Punjabi believes the exit polls...EC monitors that voters aren't influenced but nowadays some governments get opinion polls conducted using public money. AAP has done this," Badal added.

331.title: 2,500 Meghalaya health workers opted not to get COVID vaccine: Health Minister
331.article_body: There are 2,505 healthcare workers in Meghalaya, mostly working in government health facilities, who have chosen not to get vaccinated against COVID-19, state Health Minister, James K Sangma said. The total number of unvaccinated health care workers in government hospitals is 2,456 while in private hospitals, only 49 have opted not to get vaccinated, Sangma added.

332.title: Always scores big in India: Gavaskar on Agarwal being preferred over Gill
332.article_body: Talking about India's decision to play Mayank Agarwal in KL Rahul's absence in the first Test against Sri Lanka, Sunil Gavaskar said Agarwal "bats like a boss" in home games and he should be preferred over Shubman Gill. Gavaskar added, "He (Gill) hasn't played any cricket in last two months...he has the talent, but, it's also about form."

333.title: Mumbai court recommends joint parenting in divorce cases
333.article_body: Citing a judgement of the Bombay High Court from January 2016, a family court in Mumbai issued a circular calling upon lawyers, judges, and marriage counsellors to explore the possibility of shared parenting in divorce cases. The High Court had earlier observed joint parenting should be the rule and single parenting an exception if both the parents are available.

334.title: UN human rights chief to visit China's Xinjiang in May
334.article_body: UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Michelle Bachelet has said she will visit Xinjiang province in China in May. She has been pressing for the visit to look into the reports of rights abuse of Uyghur Muslims in the region. "I am pleased to announce that we have recently reached an agreement with the government of China," said Bachelet.

335.title: Warne didn't discuss Eng coach role as I would've talked him out: Ponting
335.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne who passed away aged 52, Ricky Ponting said Warne didn't discuss potentially becoming England's head coach with him as he would have tried "talking him out of it" pretty quickly. "Having someone like Warne to take over the England cricket team, I think he would have done a terrific job," added Ponting.

336.title: Traffic police implements odd-even parking in Bandra, Khar
336.article_body: The traffic police department has implemented an odd-even parking system in Bandra and Khar areas of Mumbai to ease congestion. As per the system, parking is allowed on east side of road when the calendar date is even, while it is allowed on the west side when the date is odd. The system has been implemented on 13 roads.

337.title: Iran launches second military satellite Noor-2 into space: Report
337.article_body: Iran has launched its second military satellite Noor-2 into space, according to the state media. "Iran's second military satellite, named Noor-2, has been launched into space by the Qassed rocket of the aerospace wing of the Revolutionary Guards and successfully placed in orbit 500 kilometers above the Earth," said the report. The first Noor satellite was launched in April 2020.

338.title: Putin is angry: US spy chief warns Russia could 'double down' in Ukraine
338.article_body: The chief of American spy agency CIA, William Burns, warned of an "ugly next few weeks" in Ukraine. "I think Russian President Vladimir Putin is angry, frustrated right now. He's likely to double down and try to grind down...Ukrainian military with no regard for civilian casualties," Burns said. This is "a matter of deep personal conviction" for Putin, Burns added.

339.title: Women shouldn't confine to kitchen: Kerala's 1st female ambulance driver
339.article_body: Deepamol from Kottayam has become Kerala's first woman ambulance driver in the government sector. Deepamol said that women shouldn't confine themselves to kitchen and should have will to take up any job to gain financial independence. State Health Minister Veena George handed over the keys of 'KANIV-108' ambulance to 42-year-old Deepamol on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday.

340.title: She's at home: Saba to troll who asked 'Where's Amrita Singh' in her post
340.article_body: On Women's Day,  Saif Ali Khan's sister Saba Ali Khan dedicated a post to all the women members of her family including sister-in-law Kareena Kapoor. However, users pointed out that Saba had not included Saif's ex-wife and actress Amrita Singh in her post. Replying to a troll, who asked 'Where is Amrita', Saba wrote, "[She's] sleeping safely at home...I suppose."

341.title: Went for look test, couldn't recognise myself: Lara on playing Indira Gandhi
341.article_body: Actress Lara Dutta who played late Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in 'BellBottom' said she could not recognise herself when she went for look test. "I had to go close to mirror...look into my eyes...could see it was me...body language, understanding her state of mind, all that went into...being worked upon to get under skin...that was how...character was completed," she added.

342.title: Liquor law passed without any legislative study: SC to Bihar govt
342.article_body: The Supreme Court lashed out at the Bihar government over its liquor law and said that "this law is creating crowding". "Rectify it or release everybody on bail till rectification is done. You have passed the law without any legislative impact study," the court added. "Burden is on you (Bihar government) to correct the course," the bench further said.

343.title: Universal Music suspends operations, closes offices in Russia
343.article_body: Universal Music Group has said it is suspending all operations in Russia and closing its offices, amid the growing protest from global firms against the violence in Ukraine. "We are adhering to international sanctions and...have been working with groups from a range of countries...to support humanitarian relief efforts," it said. It also urged for an end to violence in Ukraine.

344.title: I'll remember that 12-km walk from Kharkiv carrying Indian flag: Ukraine-returned student
344.article_body: Shwetha Thirumalai Kumaraswamy, a first-year medical student in Ukraine who returned to India on Tuesday, has said, "I will remember that 12-km walk from Kharkiv railway station to Pisochyn carrying the Indian national flag when we were exposed to all kinds of threats." She added, "Shelling haunted us from Kharkiv to Romanian border...we comforted our parents by lying to them."

345.title: Why will cricketers not be allowed to apply saliva on ball?
345.article_body: As per new MCC laws, cricketers won't be allowed to apply saliva on ball from October 1. "MCC’s research found that this had little or no impact on the amount of swing the bowlers were getting," MCC said. It will also remove any grey areas of fielders eating sugary sweets to alter their saliva to apply to ball, MCC added.

346.title: LIC gets SEBI nod for India's biggest-ever IPO: Reports
346.article_body: State-run Life Insurance Corporation of India has reportedly received market regulator SEBI's approval for an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO is expected to be the country's biggest-ever public issue. According to its draft papers filed on February 13, LIC will offload 31.62 crore shares. Earlier, reports said the government may defer the IPO to next fiscal amid Russia-Ukraine war.

347.title: Hijacker of 1999 Indian Airlines flight shot dead in Pakistan: Reports
347.article_body: Mistry Zahoor Ibrahim, one of the hijackers of the IC-814 Indian Airlines flight from Kathmandu to Delhi in 1999, was shot dead in Pakistan's Karachi, according to reports.
