The Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorist was living under a false identity "Zahid Akhund" for many years. He was reportedly shot twice in the head by unidentified gunmen in Karachi's Akhtar Colony on March 1.

348.title: Ukraine's First Lady pens open letter, says 'We do not know how long the war will last'
348.article_body: Penning an open letter to global media, Ukraine's First Lady Olena Zelenska said, "We don't know how long [war with Russia] will last." She added, "If we don't stop [Vladimir] Putin, who threatens to start a nuclear war, there will be no safe place in the world for any of us." She further wrote, "We'll win. Because of our unity."

349.title: Court acquits Mumbai taxi driver on charges of disobeying woman police
349.article_body: A sessions court acquitted a Mumbai-based taxi driver from charges of disobeying a woman police personnel from discharging her duties. As per the complaint, the driver when stopped from driving in no-entry zone misbehaved with the police personnel. There is "absolutely nothing" in this evidence to show that he caused hindrance to police personnel in performing duty, the court said.

350.title: 1 Russian ruble now worth less than 1 American penny: US President Biden
350.article_body: While announcing a ban on imports of Russian oil and gas, US President Joe Biden said that the country's "most significant package of economic sanctions in history" has caused the Russian economy to "crater". "The Russian ruble is now down...by 50% since Putin announced his war. One ruble is now worth less than one American penny," he added.

351.title: We've lost contact with monitoring systems at Chernobyl plant: Nuclear watchdog
351.article_body: International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has said it has lost contact with remote data transmission from safeguards monitoring systems installed at Chernobyl nuclear power plant in northern Ukraine, which was taken over by Russian forces. The Chernobyl site is not currently operational and handling of nuclear material has been halted, the IAEA added. The facility holds decommissioned reactors.

352.title: Joining NATO now would destabilise northern Europe: Swedish PM
352.article_body: Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson has rejected opposition calls to consider joining NATO following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. An application now would "destabilise" northern Europe and "increase tensions", Andersson said. Last month, Russia had warned Sweden and Finland to not join the NATO military alliance, saying that the move "would have serious military and political consequences".

353.title: Anish Khan died while climbing down pipe to escape police: TMC MLA
353.article_body: Trinamool Congress MLA from Canning Purba, Saokat Molla, has claimed that student leader Anish Khan died when he was climbing down a pipe while trying to escape police. "When police reached his house, Anish tried to escape...but he fell off and died," he added. "Was Molla present there? I suggest SIT members question him," BJP's Dilip Ghosh remarked.

354.title: Russia violated ceasefire agreement in Ukraine for third straight day: UK
354.article_body: Russia violated ceasefire agreement to allow humanitarian corridors in Ukraine for the third straight day, claimed UK's defence ministry. "Russian forces have reportedly disrupted the humanitarian corridors in Mariupol and Sumy," said UK. "Shelling and small-arms fire were reported throughout the day although it's likely that some civilians have been able to flee the besieged cities," it added.

355.title: Lord Krishna came to my dream, said CM Yogi will form govt in UP: BJP MP
355.article_body: After the exit polls predicted BJP's return to power in UP, Rajya Sabha MP Harnath Singh Yadav on Tuesday said that the predictions are true. Yadav added that Lord Krishna came to his dream and told him that CM Yogi Adityanath will form government in the state. "The exit polls are not random," Yadav stated.

356.title: US charges 2 siblings in $124 million crypto fraud operation
356.article_body: The US SEC has charged two siblings, John and JonAtina Barksdale, accusing them of defrauding retail investors out of more than $124 million with a digital token known as Ormeus Coin. Since 2017, the accused had allegedly raised $124 million from over 20,000 investors. They promoted Ormeus Coin through roadshows and social media, as well as a Times Square jumbotron.

357.title: Will ensure conflict doesn’t spread beyond Ukraine: NATO
357.article_body: NATO said it will ensure the Russia-Ukraine conflict doesn't spread to other countries. "We have a responsibility to ensure the conflict does not escalate and spread beyond Ukraine," NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg said. "We will protect and defend every inch of all allied territory," he added. Meanwhile, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he will no longer press for NATO membership.

358.title: We have to be patient: GT's Director of Cricket on Pandya's fitness
358.article_body: Gujarat Titans' Director of Cricket Vikram Solanki has said their captain Hardik Pandya is on his path to recovery and playing a full part but they have to be patient with the demands. "Hardik is working extremely hard in all aspects of his game...He's conscious that he has to get up to speed with batting, bowling and fielding," added Vikram.

359.title: Told him not to assume I'd do anything for him: Sham on Vicky joining B'wood
359.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal's father Sham Kaushal, who's a renowned action director in Bollywood, recalled how he couldn't refuse Vicky when he said he wanted to join the films soon after clearing his engineering course. Sham said he explained to Vicky that he shouldn't assume his father would do anything for him, in fact, he had to earn his position.

360.title: WB Speaker rejects Governor's request to meet over ruckus in Assembly
360.article_body: West Bengal Assembly Speaker Biman Banerjee rejected Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar's request to meet over ruckus in the Assembly. "Urged Speaker for a meeting...in view of 'unseemly ruckus and chaotic spectacle unfolded in the hallowed precincts of the Assembly on March 7'," Dhankhar tweeted. The Speaker rejected the request saying he was preoccupied due to the ongoing Assembly session, ANI reported.

361.title: Delhi cabinet gives approval for restructuring, strengthening DDC
361.article_body: The Delhi government has approved the proposal for restructuring and strengthening its policy think tank, the Dialogue and Development Commission (DDC), its Vice-Chairperson Jasmine Shah said on Tuesday. The commission will now have 48 sanctioned posts. Out of these, 26 policy makers from several domains from across the world will be employed on a contractual basis, Shah added.

362.title: People come to watch so-called good-looking stars in glossy films: Tandav actor
362.article_body: 'Tandav' actor Mohd Zeeshan Ayyub said it's unfortunate that good actors aren't getting good roles. He added, "If it's a glossy film selling dream, then...people come to watch the so-called good-looking stars." "It's also a part of our conditioning that only fair people look good," Ayyub said. He further added that things are changing now because of OTT.

363.title: GSK and MS Dhoni team up for 6 in 1 vaccination awareness campaign
363.article_body: GSK launches a new public interest campaign featuring MS Dhoni, to raise awareness about the need for prevention of 6 diseases with just 1 vaccination. The awareness film, featuring Dhoni, draws parallel between hitting a six in cricket and '6 in 1' vaccination for infants. The campaign's tagline, 'Less injections, less pain' encapsulates the key benefits of this combination vaccination.

364.title: Everyone said I should lose some weight after my 1st Kannada film: Meghana Raj
364.article_body: Actress Meghana Raj said that everybody started telling her to "lose some weight" after her first Kannada film. "But the Malayalam industry had accepted me exactly the way I was...in 'Beautiful'...my skin was really bad...I had weight issues...my director [told me] 'I do not want you to put makeup'." Meghana said that she often felt something was wrong with her.

365.title: Man poses as police officer, extorts money from spas in Pune; held
365.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police arrested 28-year-old real estate agent, Vishal Jaunjale, for allegedly posing as a police officer and extorting money from spas and massage parlours by claiming he had recorded videos on premises. Jaunjale was asking for ₹1 lakh after allegedly shooting video at spa. Police got spa owner to arrange a meeting with him at a restaurant and caught him.

366.title: 3 constables injured as explosives explode while defusing in Raigad
366.article_body: Two police constables of the Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad (BDDS) were seriously injured while another suffered minor injuries after explosives that were being disposed of suddenly exploded. The incident occurred on Tuesday in Maharashtra's Raigad district. "The BDDS team was disposing of explosives recovered in a case of 2013. The explosives included gelatin and detonators," an official said.

367.title: Russia's rating cut for 2nd time in a week by Fitch
367.article_body: Russia's sovereign rating has been downgraded by six notches to the second lowest level of 'C' by Fitch Ratings, which said that a bond default is "imminent". "This rating action follows our downgrade...to 'B'/Rating Watch Negative on 2 March," it said. "Developments since then have...further undermined Russia's willingness to service government debt," the rating agency added amid sanctions.

368.title: India reports 4,575 new COVID-19 cases, 14.5% higher than yesterday
368.article_body: India has reported 4,575 new COVID-19 cases and 145 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,993 cases and 108 deaths. Out of the 145 deaths, 45 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 100 were reconciled deaths in Kerala.

369.title: India's 1st women-owned industrial park opens in Hyderabad
369.article_body: India's first 100% women-owned industrial park called FLO Industrial Park began operations in Hyderabad's Sultanpur on Tuesday. "The park promoted by FICCI Ladies Organization (FLO) in partnership with Telangana government, has announced the commencement of operations," Telangana IT and Industries Minister KT Rama Rao said. The park has been set up in 50 acres with an investment of ₹250 crore.

370.title: 'Mankading' no longer 'unfair play' as cricket laws amended
370.article_body: In MCC's 'The Laws of Cricket 2017 Code (3rd Edition - 2022)', 'mankading' has been moved from Law 41 (Unfair play) to Law 38 (Run-out). MCC said that the wording of the law will remain the same. 'Mankad' is a rare form of dismissal wherein a bowler runs out non-striker after the latter leaves crease even before ball is delivered.

371.title: Liverpool reach Champions League quarters with 2-1 aggregate win vs Inter
371.article_body: Liverpool suffered 0-1 defeat to Inter Milan in the Champions League last-16 second leg but advanced to the quarterfinals with a 2-1 aggregate in the tie. Lautaro Martinez put Inter ahead in the 61st minute but they were reduced to 10 men after Alexis Sanchez was sent off moments later. This was Liverpool's first defeat in the competition this season.

372.title: 32-year-old carpenter in Pune robbed by 2 men posing as customers
372.article_body: A 32-year-old carpenter was allegedly robbed by two men who claimed to be customers and called him to a secluded spot on the pretext of giving him work, police said. When the victim reached the location, the accused allegedly threatened to kill him and robbed him of ₹5,000 cash, and also forced him to transfer ₹42,800 using various UPI-based e-wallets.

373.title: I've done my best to lead NSE in a difficult period: CEO on not seeking 2nd term
373.article_body: National Stock Exchange (NSE) MD & CEO Vikram Limaye said that he won't apply for a second term as his first five-year term ends in July 2022. "I've done my best to lead the organisation in a very difficult period and to stabilise, strengthen and transform NSE," he added. Earlier, NSE published an advertisement calling for candidates for CEO role.

374.title: Exit polls of Punjab are far from reality: Congress' Harish Rawat
374.article_body: As exit polls predicted that AAP will be getting the majority in Punjab Assembly polls, Congress leader Harish Rawat said that the exit polls are far from reality. "How would AAP get votes where it never exists? Congress is coming with a good mandate. I have full faith that we will form our government there (Punjab)," Rawat added.

375.title: Robert Vadra under-reported ₹106 cr income over 11 years: I-T Department
375.article_body: Businessman and husband of Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Robert Vadra, under-reported his income from benami properties by ₹106 crore over 11 years from assessment years 2010-11 to 2020-21, claimed the Income Tax Department. The Department further alleged that seven companies owned by him also under-reported income by about ₹9 crore over assessment years 2010-11 to 2015-16.

376.title: Under PM Modi, India more likely to respond to Pak provocations: US Intelligence
376.article_body: Under Prime Minister Narendra Modi, India is more likely than in the past to respond with military force to any real or perceived Pakistani provocations, the US Intelligence Community has told the US Congress. "Pakistan has a long history of supporting anti-India militant groups...and each side's perception of heightened tensions raises the risk of conflict," it said.

377.title: Congress deploys senior leaders in Uttarakhand ahead of poll results
377.article_body: Ahead of the counting of votes in Uttarakhand, the AICC on Tuesday deployed senior Congress leaders in 13 districts of the state in order to coordinate with the party candidates. The party has sent senior leaders including party MPs, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel and AICC office-bearers. Other leaders include Congress MP Deepender Singh Hooda, AICC observer Mohan Prakash among others.

378.title: Amazon cloud unit stops taking new customers in Russia, Belarus
378.article_body: Amazon's cloud-computing unit AWS is no longer accepting new sign-ups based in Russia or Belarus, the firm announced. Amazon said the AWS unit had "no data centers, infrastructure or offices in Russia, and we have a long-standing policy of not doing business with the Russian government". AWS' biggest customers in Russia are companies with headquarters outside of the country.

379.title: Action to be taken against firms not prioritising locals: K'taka minister
379.article_body: Karnataka minister Murugesh R Nirani said action will be taken against companies if they fail to prioritise jobs for Kannadigas or those native to the southern state. "As per a clause in the 2020-25 Industrial Policy, the individual units must provide 100% jobs in D group and 70% of total jobs to Kannadigas," Nirani said in the legislative council.

380.title: K'taka govt launches programme to provide 5 lakh jobs to women till 2026
380.article_body: Karnataka government launched Women@Work (W@W) programme on Tuesday with an aim to provide five lakh jobs to women till 2026. The initiative which would contribute to the country's GDP growth is a part of Karnataka's Digital Economy Mission. Women will also be given free certificate courses as a part of this programme to train them technically in various disciplines.

381.title: Russia announces ceasefire in Ukraine for Wednesday morning
381.article_body: Russia has announced a humanitarian ceasefire in Ukraine starting at 10 am Moscow time on Wednesday for the evacuation of civilians. Russia has declared a 'regime of silence' and is reportedly ready to provide humanitarian corridors from a number of cities including Kyiv, Chernihiv, Sumy, Kharkiv, Mariupol, and Zaporizhzhia. On Tuesday, civilian evacuations took place from Sumy.

382.title: Chandigarh Police launches women patrol vehicles on Women's Day
382.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, Chandigarh Police launched women patrolling vehicles in the city. The patrol vehicles were flagged off during a cultural-cum-educative programme at the Government College for Girls in Sector 42, on Tuesday. The cyber interns of Chandigarh Police also spread awareness about cyber security for women during the programme.

383.title: TN farmer ends life after firm seizes tractor for loan default
383.article_body: A 23-year-old farmer from Tamil Nadu's Viluppuram district died allegedly by suicide after agents of a private finance company seized one of his tractors and insulted him and his family for defaulting a loan. Police have registered a case against two employees of the firm. "The family wants monetary compensation, a loan waiver and return of tractor," said an official.

384.title: Lewandowski's 11-minute hat-trick help Bayern advance in Champions League
384.article_body: Robert Lewandowski scored three times in 11 minutes as Bayern Munich advanced to the Champions League quarterfinals with a 7-1 win over FC Salzburg. The German club won the last-16 tie 8-2 on aggregate after a 1-1 draw in Salzburg last month. Notably, Lewandowski's hat-trick inside 23 minutes from kick-off was the fastest in Champions League history.

385.title: EVMs were for training: EC after Akhilesh claims machines 'stolen' in Varanasi
385.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) has issued a statement after Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday alleged that EVMs were being stolen in Varanasi. "In the investigation, it has been found that these EVMs were marked for training," the CEO said. EVMs were being transported to train the officials involved in counting duty, the CEO added.

386.title: I wasn't willing to do 'Kahaani'; had no idea it'll be a hit: Nawazuddin
386.article_body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui said he's proud he did 'Kahaani' as the film changed his career. He added initially, he didn't have any idea that the film will be a hit. "Actually, I wasn't [willing to do] 'Kahaani'," he said. "Sujoy (director) called...and...set up a meeting at a restaurant...where he showed me a documentary, following which I got interested," he added.

387.title: SP leader Azam Khan gets bail in defamation case, to stay in jail
387.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has granted bail to Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan in a defamation case lodged against him in 2019. "The complainant has alleged that Azam Khan had attempted to disrupt the image of cleric Maulana Kalbe Jawad by issuing false statements," said Khan's lawyer. Khan, who has been booked in multiple cases, will remain in jail.

388.title: 2 post offices in Pune declared 'all-women' on International Women's Day
388.article_body: In a first for Pune, two post offices in city, Pune Cantonment (east) and Dr BA chowk, were declared women post offices on occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. Four women staffers each will manage all postal operations at post offices. "This initiative aims at offering more ease for women customers to interact with women staffers," an official said.

389.title: After McDonald's, Coca-Cola, Pepsi & Starbucks suspend business in Russia
389.article_body: After McDonald's announced that it's temporarily shutting around 850 restaurants in Russia, Starbucks, Coca-Cola, PepsiCo and General Electric have suspended operations in the country. However, PepsiCo will continue to sell essentials like milk and baby food. Cereal manufacturer Kellogg's, KFC parent Yum Brands and Kraft Heinz are suspending their investment into Russia amid Ukraine invasion.

390.title: Pakistan national thanks Indian embassy and PM Modi for rescuing her in Ukraine
390.article_body: A video has surfaced online which shows a Pakistan woman named Asma Shafique thanking the Indian embassy in Kyiv and Prime Minister Narendra Modi for rescuing her "from a difficult situation" in war-torn Ukraine. She was rescued by the Indian authorities and is on her way to Western Ukraine for evacuation out of the country, ANI reported.

391.title: What are the new rules of cricket announced by MCC?
391.article_body: As per new cricket laws announced by MCC, cricketers won't be allowed to use saliva on ball. 'Mankading' has been removed from 'unfair play' section to 'run-out'. New batters will face next delivery after a player is given out caught even if batters have crossed before catch is taken. Wides will be judged based on where batters are standing.

392.title: 3 wanted in 14 cases of house thefts arrested in B'luru; 1.12 kg gold seized
392.article_body: The Nandini Layout Police have arrested three habitual offenders wanted in 14 cases of house break-ins and thefts in Bengaluru. A total of 1.12 kg of gold ornaments and 1.96 kg of silver articles worth ₹55.18 lakh have been seized from the accused, Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said. Pant also announced a reward of ₹40,000 for the police team.

393.title: Oldest known ancestor of vampire squids, octopuses named after Biden
393.article_body: Researchers have identified the oldest known ancestor of vampyropods and named it after US President Joe Biden. 'Syllipsimopodi bideni' had 10 arms, fins, and rows of suckers to grasp prey. It lived 328 million years ago and represents a new species of vampyropods, the group of marine animals that includes vampire squids and octopuses.

394.title: Ukraine will never be a victory for Putin: US President Biden
394.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said the war in Ukraine would never be a victory for his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin. He said Putin may be able to take a city, but will never be able to hold the country. Biden announced a ban on US import of Russian oil, gas and energy in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

395.title: Mumbai to get its first air-conditioned unisex salon inside rail premises
395.article_body: Mumbai will get its first air-conditioned unisex salon-cum-spa corner inside rail premises at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus. "This is certainly an interesting idea that we are exploring at CSMT and other stations as well. The one at CSMT is expected to be opened in 2-3 months," a CR official said. Facilities like massage, shaving, hair cutting will be provided here.

396.title: 5 students kidnap Class 12 boy over free passes for party in Gurugram
396.article_body: Police booked five students for allegedly kidnapping and assaulting a Class 12 boy after he refused them free passes for a party in Gurugram's Sector 29. Four suspects are students of Class 12 and one is a first-year student of law, police said. The accused met the victim at a mall and took him to a deserted place, police added.

397.title: Woman kills relative who assaulted her, semi-decomposed body found in Delhi
397.article_body: A 44-year-old woman, her son and his friend were arrested for allegedly thrashing her 35-year-old relative to death in Delhi. The man, Jaipal, was murdered after woman allegedly faced humiliation as he assaulted her, made video and sent it to her, her son and at least two relatives. Police said Jaipal's nude and semi decomposed body was found in flat.

398.title: Apple unveils Studio Display, Mac Studio starting from ₹1,59,900 & ₹1,89,900
398.article_body: Apple has launched a 27-inch Studio Display along with a Mac Studio featuring the new M1 Ultra and the M1 Max processor. The Studio Display sports a 5K Retina display, a 12-MP ultrawide camera, three USB-C ports and starts at ₹1,59,900. Apple's new display-less desktop computer, Mac Studio, includes USB-C ports and an SD card slot and starts at ₹1,89,900.

399.title: McDonald's temporarily shuts Russian restaurants, says 'can't ignore suffering in Ukraine'
399.article_body: McDonald's has announced it is temporarily closing all of its 850 restaurants in Russia, saying, "Our values mean we cannot ignore the needless human suffering unfolding in Ukraine." CEO Chris Kempczinski said the company will continue paying its 62,000 employees in Russia, adding, "At this juncture, it's impossible to predict when we might be able to reopen our restaurants."

400.title: Apple introduces 2 new colours for iPhone 13 lineup
400.article_body: Apple has announced two new colours for iPhone 13 Pro and iPhone 13, alpine green and green. "These new colours give customers even more options when choosing their iPhone, and we can't wait for them to take advantage of all the iPhone 13 lineup offers," said Bob Borchers, Apple's vice president of Worldwide Product Marketing.
